revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 22:26:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix typo in vncproxy_base_url var name

As noted in the bug report, the same var was used twice, when
it should have been the two different ones - as updated.

fixes bug 1154307

Change-Id: I9cf4c97b04a70718eda42163e70c5093bf49c158
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo in vncproxy_base_url var name

As noted in the bug report, the same var was used twice, when
it should have been the two different ones - as updated.

fixes bug 1154307

Change-Id: I9cf4c97b04a70718eda42163e70c5093bf49c158

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-03-14 16:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

On the comment about common libs being updated piecemeal, would the mechanism described here:

  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo

to override the modules in the openstack-common.conf via the --modules command line arg be helpful?

e.g.

  python update.py --base ceilometer --dest-dir ../ceilometer --modules log'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-03-14 16:58:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's not clear what, if any, cross-dependencies exist between the various libraries. I know logging can trigger RPC calls, for example, so I assume I need to update RPC and logging together. Are there others, similar, dependencies? It seems safer to just update everything at once."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-03-14 17:40:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Fair enough, we should probably go through the process more regularly avoid big bang updates.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-03-15 00:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Update openstack.common

The main motivation for this update is to fix
the way logging is configured so that all
libraries are able to log at the default level.
The other changes come in because there's no
clean way to update the common libs piecemeal.

bug 1152584

Change-Id: I22563f7c0aa7c48edc81cb85328c3ae3ec8c2f11
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Fix ISCSIDriver rescan.

Cinder fails to rescan iSCSI targets after running copy_image_to_volume
or copy_volume_to_image with the generic iSCSI implementation, due to
a missing comma.

Change-Id: I726e8da1f0221e47bae2593e03bc88a47c487814
Fixes: bug 1144591

commit_message:
Do cleaning up resource before rescheduling.

Fix bug: #1153964

If some exception raised when spawn instance, the instance will be
rescheduled to other host. But just deallocate network before
rescheduling is not enough, like security group filters and volumes
will stay on old host.

So shutdown instance and clean up volumes instead of just deallocate
network before rescheduling.

Change-Id: Ieb6220ae66f0b97a92c50f6998f456968b516fcb

commit_message:
Support for separate Keystone paste.deploy configuration

Support for Keystone change https://review.openstack.org/24126
while keeping the backward compatiblity with mixed cfg/paste.deploy
configuration file.

Also remove insertion of s3 extension which was merged in
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/commit/b2aa620bc9d040f803c49707237f43ff1a04ef93

Change-Id: Ib7e2913ebb507f882dcd71b1142bcdb4b040ae6b

[{'created': '2013-03-14 01:18:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix system_metadata "None" and created_at values

The ill-fated migration 153 converted None instance_type values to
"None" in the database instead of properly making them NULL. This
corrects that by sweeping all of the values and converting "None" to
NULL. Also, it adds a belated created_at stamp to all of the items,
which was missing in 153 as well.

It also corrects the 153 migration to avoid polluting things in the
first place for systems that haven't rolled through that yet.

Fixes bug 1152546

commit_message:
Fix system_metadata "None" and created_at values

The ill-fated migration 153 converted None instance_type values to
"None" in the database instead of properly making them NULL. This
corrects that by sweeping all of the likely instance_type_% values and
converting "None" to NULL. Also, it adds a belated created_at stamp
to all of the items, which was missing in 153 as well.

It also corrects the 153 migration to avoid polluting things in the
first place for systems that haven't rolled through that yet.

Fixes bug 1152546

Change-Id: I3585463ae15abfd534f2ff070e2974f3cb51d7e8

commit_message:
Fix 3PAR driver hiding existing host error

This fixes a problem with the 3par drivers where creating
a 3par host was failing but there was no message.  The driver
would fail to find the host after the creation failed and the
log entry would show that the host didn't exist.   The real
error was failing to create the host.

bug #1154700

Change-Id: I2267d958f10cc73c6c5f34d224ea3452a4402f18

commit_message:
Count Snapshots towards volume/gigabyte quotas.

Cinder has quotas and limits for volume-count and Gigabytes used,
however we were only counting volumes against these quotas.

This change introduces a snapshot-count limit and also counts
snapshots against this Gigabytes quota allowed for a Tenant.

Fixed bug: 1137927

Change-Id: Ib9b00b84b05597de9b5725a7f5898fe10a20b9d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-14 20:54:06.000000000', 'message': "Don't include traceback when wrapping exceptions

The fix in fa52cb09b2270876c9d9a03106f961be6c9db834 strips tracebacks
from exceptions when returning them to the user, but it still spams
the log with a long traceback. We shouldn't be including the traceback
when we wrap the exception in the first place. Instead we just
include the message.

It also updates the error code to 409 for device in use since this
is actually a conflict.

Fix for:

  bug 1155315
  bug 1103324
  bug 1092610

Change-Id: I95019a3022eb52e0335c455009c13fe229475d03
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include traceback when wrapping exceptions

The fix in fa52cb09b2270876c9d9a03106f961be6c9db834 strips tracebacks
from exceptions when returning them to the user, but it still spams
the log with a long traceback. We shouldn't be including the traceback
when we wrap the exception in the first place. Instead we just
include the message.

It also updates the error code to 409 for device in use since this
is actually a conflict.

Fix for:

  bug 1155315
  bug 1103324
  bug 1092610

Change-Id: I95019a3022eb52e0335c455009c13fe229475d03

commit_message:
Add the serial to connection info for boot volumes

The serial parameter wasn't being added to volumes specified at
boot time. Added tests. Also cleaned up import in test_compute
to match the rest of the file.

Fixes bug 1148734

Change-Id: I05a623849680c5d0bb530fba4c4e6051d3b000aa

commit_message:
Allow per-deployment configuration of user id

Previously user ids of new instances were limited to ec2-user.
This patch adds a new configuration option to be placed in
/etc/heat/heat-engine.conf called "default_instance_user" which
allows the default of ec2-user to be overriden.

Note for reviewers that runcmd does not work properly.  It was
actually running after the loguserdata.py script finished execution.

Fixes: Bug #1101347
Change-Id: Ica2dbe63d9dcbce8bb8de298eba452c34ab173d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-14 14:40:02.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ssh from cloud-config-files

the cc_ssh script already executes in cloud config without being
explicitly called.  As it is now, it is executing twice.

Make it execute only once.

Change-Id: I2d53adbea0175f63db71be516639d40aa0f8a1de
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ssh from cloud-config-files

the cc_ssh script already executes in cloud config without being
explicitly called.  As it is now, it is executing twice.

Make it execute only once.

Change-Id: I2d53adbea0175f63db71be516639d40aa0f8a1de

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 15:01:04.000000000', 'message': "Rename LOGNAME to LOGFILENAME.

LOGNAME has historically been used for the username.  Using it for
the logfile name causes confusion.  For example, Python's
getpass.getuser() will return the value of LOGNAME.

Change-Id: I3f569d54f93c4898654fddb91f3b569831e75a2c
"}]
commit_message:
Rename LOGNAME to LOGFILENAME.

LOGNAME has historically been used for the username.  Using it for
the logfile name causes confusion.  For example, Python's
getpass.getuser() will return the value of LOGNAME.

Change-Id: I3f569d54f93c4898654fddb91f3b569831e75a2c

Segmented images not deleted cleanly from swift.

Ensure the manifest is deleted in addition to the image data segments.

Fixes Bug #1144681

commit_message:
Resolves ryu plugin unittest errors

Removed obsolete DATABASE value tests in ryu/test_defaults.py
Added fake_ryu client in test_ryu_security_group.py
Imported quantum.plugins.ryu.db.models_v2 in test_ryu_plugin.py

Fixes bug #1151642

Fixed bug #1136964.

1. Added 3 ini functions to support MultiStrOpt:
  Function "iniset_multiline config-file section option value1 value2
value3 ..." sets a MultiStrOpt option in an ini file.

  Function "iniget_multiline config-file section option" gets the
MultiStrOpt option values.

commit_message:
Support MultiStrOpt options in configuration file.

Fixed bug #1136964.

1. Added 3 ini functions to support MultiStrOpt:
  Function "iniset_multiline config-file section option value1 value2
value3 ..." sets a MultiStrOpt option in an ini file.

  Function "iniget_multiline config-file section option" gets the
MultiStrOpt option values.

  Function "iniadd config-file section option value1 value2 value3..."
appends an option without relacing the old values, which would result
the option to be MultiStrOpt.

2. Modified the nova configuation to correctly enable notification for
ceilometer.

Change-Id: I1c27db1a6e58b35bc4428e761f40627988f69e37

commit_message:
Handle LSB data for openSUSE 12.3

The LSB vendor changed to "openSUSE project" in openSUSE 12.3. Deal with
it as if it were simply "openSUSE".

Change-Id: Id20eac6abba4c07aed1cf4617e89357974f62ff8

Add policy_file option to quantum.conf

Bug 1154102

Ensure /etc/quantum/policy.json is the one used by quantum when
deployed through devstack.

commit_message:
Fixes an iSCSI connector issue in the Hyper-V driver.

It fixes how Hyper-v nova driver is returning iscsi connection
information. It affects the way cinder plugins used that
information to implement ACL based on initiator_name.

Fixes: bug #1153975

Change-Id: I40dc3bba9c9a76585ba9bdd938043d4bfef195c8

commit_message:
Adding instance ID to DNS error message.

Currently the message is unhelpful as it gets lost in all
the other messages. This adds the instance ID so that ops
can track down the failed instance and correct it.

Change-Id: If9d256bf971b056a6636568efe788c7cb2c2ef5f
Fixes: bug 1154798

commit_message:
Do not return location in headers

In some cases credentials were being leaked when downloading a cached
v1 image.

Fixes bug 1135541, CVE-2013-1840

Change-Id: Ib16ad40d3ea1c642384053be54ce029c386d7ea6

subject: Use v2.0 api by default in auth_token middleware
messages:
[{'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-12 15:30:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

My guess is that this slipped past the gate because devstack uses explicit 'v2.0' on its keystone URL's. Using the v3.0 API at this point just leaves me with credentials errors...."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-12 15:53:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So understand the need to resolve, but not sure this is the right fix (since this means v3 tokens will fail to be validated).  You can force auth_token to use a specific version by setting auth_version='v2.0' (for example) in the config - can we not do that in Smokestack?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-12 15:56:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

henry: The gist of this fix is that v3.0 breaks my setup. v2.0 does not! So for backwards compat it seems pretty clear to me that v2.0 should still be our default (when no version is specified).

Testing v3.0 can certainly proceed by explicitly using it in the keystone URL's and config files."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:05:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, so let's allow everyone to continue while we work out the best plan.  To do this, let's set the auth_version default to v2.0, by changing:

cfg.StrOpt('auth_version', default=None),

to

cfg.StrOpt('auth_version', default='v2.0'),

rather than change the order in LIST_VERSIONS_TO_ATTEMPT, since other changes will depend on that order being highest->lowest."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:11:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

henry-nash: re. your suggestion to default cfg.StrOpt('auth_version', default='v2.0'). If we do that doesn't it entirely eliminate need for the code where LIST_OF_VERSIONS_TO_ATTEMPT is actually used?

So if we do that LIST_OF_VERSIONS_TO_ATTEMPT goes away entirely. (meaning you'd need to explicitly set it to v3.0)"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/24186/1/check/gate-python-keystoneclient-pep8/883 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/24186/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/13560 : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

So approving this to fix smokestack for now, while we work out and agree the correct approach for the final Grizzly release'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Henry, I wonder if the version detection code is necessary. Seems like configuring auth_version is good enough.'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:33:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Guang - yes...I'd rather set this in the cfg default, maybe leave the version testing code in for now, since we may enable in the future"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think have the server controlling the default client versions without having to update all the clients authtoken ini files when the operator wants to switch to the new version is a good feature to have.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script.'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:37:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Okay. Now that I've pulled in the latest tools/install_venv_common.py from Oslo I can actually run tests... so let me see about fixing those."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-12 16:53:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Let me evaluate before we merge this.  I am not sure if unversioned URLs defaulting to 2.0 is correct."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-12 17:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

This is fine as a short term change to default back to v2.0 in order to get the tests running. 
 Please provide a detailed bug report for what the actual error was, and we will make sure that the fix to using V3.0 for auth_token goes into keystone. We will then switch devstack over to using V3.0, and finally we default to V3.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-03-12 17:15:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Use v2.0 api by default in auth_token middleware

Fixes an issue that crept in with d782a99 where auth_token
started defaulting to the v3.0 API by default when no version
was specified.

Given that bin/keystone still defaults to using the v2.0 API
it seems like auth_token.py should too.

Fixes LP Bug #1154144

Change-Id: Ia5620bccc182bbc73cb60dcccb1f701304450e5a

commit_message:
Add quotas for fixed ips.

DocImpact: there is now a default quota of 10 fixed ips per tenant.
This will need to be adjusted by deployers if that number does not
meet their needs.

Resolves bug 1125468 for essex.

Change-Id: I2a5afaa47afb182f4917cd43e1ebd0d6cd1330e3

"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-03-08 17:00:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

One whitespace issue I want to see addressed.  Also, this does not address the issue that caused this to be implemented in this fashion in the first place: consider receiving a quota update dict with a mix of recognized and unrecognized quota keys.  This code bails out after hitting the first unrecognized quota key, but what if some but not all of the recognized quota keys were processed?  Now the quota update has failed, but is half applied.

There are two approaches to this.  The first, which has been proposed before, is to pre-validate the full quota update, and only if it all validates is it then applied.  An alternative is to keep track of each invalid key during the entire processing, then somehow inform the caller of which keys were not applied.  In fact, in essence, this is already happening; the returned entity is the new set of quotas, which will reflect the validated updates…and omit the invalid ones."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-08 17:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-08 18:28:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-08 18:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Do not accept invalid keys in quota-update

Check if the keys are valid and respond with HTTPBadRequest
when they are not.

Found a spot in wsgi where we were trying to use xml namespace
as data for the payload, we need to skip them when converting
to json

Fix for LP# 1064864

Change-Id: Ic4a68047adf3ccf2dbac669b1b66d73bfe4d58de

commit_message:
Add quotas for fixed ips.

DocImpact: there is now a default quota of 10 fixed ips per tenant.
This will need to be adjusted by deployers if that number does not
meet their needs.

Resolves bug 1125468 for folsom.

Change-Id: I970d540cfa6a61b7e903703f845a6453ff55f225

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-03-01 13:13:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

So, the changes are fine, but I don't understand how we got to a 500 previously. Is there a tempest test case for this we can point to."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2013-03-01 17:30:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sean, the problem is that if there is an XML parsing problem, then expat.Expat exception is raised. This exception was caught inconsistently throughout the code. In some cases it wasn't caught and the exception would fall through the WSGI stack and then eventually generate a 500 error.

Since it's invalid user input, a 400 error should be returned instead. matiu's patch just consolidates all of the places that do handle the exception correctly into a centralized place, making sure it applies to all code paths and removing duplicated code.

I don't think there is a tempest test that generates invalid XML input. I think we saw this in our testing on the recent XML parsing security bug. After applying that fix it returns a 500 error (which is fine considering the security problem is much worse than a 500 error)."}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-03-03 21:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The 500 errors that this patch fixes were introduced in this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22309/'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-03-05 16:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-26 00:39:14.000000000', 'message': 'Makes safe xml data calls raise 400 http error instead of 500

When we parse incoming XML safely, if there was an error raised it would
be an expat.Expat() error, which would bubble up to the api and turn
into a HTTP 500 (Internal Error)

It turns out that all the places we use the safe_xml parsing are in
Deserializers, close to the API, so in this patch we just change the
error it raises straight to nova.exception.MalformedRequest().

This causes the api to fail with the proper 400 (Malformed Request) when
it encounters corrupt XML.

Change-Id: Ifa2ed7ee128241cfe8dbcdc5bd75194d96b6cdb5
'}, {'created': '2013-02-26 12:02:30.000000000', 'message': 'Makes safe xml data calls raise 400 http error instead of 500

When we parse incoming XML safely, if there was an error raised it would
be an expat.Expat() error, which would bubble up to the api and turn
into a HTTP 500 (Internal Error)

It turns out that all the places we use the safe_xml parsing are in
Deserializers, close to the API, so in this patch we just change the
error it raises straight to nova.exception.MalformedRequest().

This causes the api to fail with the proper 400 (Malformed Request) when
it encounters corrupt XML. This is caught at
nova.api.openstack.wsgi._process_stack and __call__.

Fixes: bug #1133111
Change-Id: Ifa2ed7ee128241cfe8dbcdc5bd75194d96b6cdb5
'}, {'created': '2013-02-27 02:20:15.000000000', 'message': 'Makes safe xml data calls raise 400 http error instead of 500

When we parse incoming XML safely, if there was an error raised it would
be an expat.Expat() error, which would bubble up to the api and turn
into a HTTP 500 (Internal Error)

It turns out that all the places we use the safe_xml parsing are in
Deserializers, close to the API, so in this patch we just change the
error it raises straight to nova.exception.MalformedRequest().

This causes the api to fail with the proper 400 (Malformed Request) when
it encounters corrupt XML. This is caught at
nova.api.openstack.wsgi._process_stack and __call__.

We also take the opportunity to move the new safe parser from nova.utils
to nova.api.openstack.xmlutil as the openstack api is the only thing
that uses it.

Fixes: bug #1133111
Change-Id: Ifa2ed7ee128241cfe8dbcdc5bd75194d96b6cdb5

commit_message:
Makes safe xml data calls raise 400 http error instead of 500

When we parse incoming XML safely, if there was an error raised it would
be an expat.Expat() error, which would bubble up to the api and turn
into a HTTP 500 (Internal Error)

It turns out that all the places we use the safe_xml parsing are in
Deserializers, close to the API, so in this patch we just change the
error it raises straight to nova.exception.MalformedRequest().

This causes the api to fail with the proper 400 (Malformed Request) when
it encounters corrupt XML. This is caught at
nova.api.openstack.wsgi._process_stack and __call__.

We also take the opportunity to move the new safe parser from nova.utils
to nova.api.openstack.xmlutil as the openstack api is the only thing
that uses it.

Fixes: bug #1133111
Change-Id: Ifa2ed7ee128241cfe8dbcdc5bd75194d96b6cdb5

commit_message:
Do not return location in headers

In some cases credentials were being leaked when downloading a cached
v1 image.

Fixes bug 1135541, CVE-2013-1840

Change-Id: I3ec0a8f484fe1bdc32c3c56fce810fcef347a7f6

commit_message:
cinder-manage does not print any version information

'cinder-manage --version' does not print anything. We need
to pass in the version information along with the argv and
project information

Change-Id: Ia826874cbbc3316226fb475646a0c146fd3a5955

commit_message:
Read instance resource quota info from "quota" namespace.

Scope all instance resource quota params such as CPU(cpu_shares,cpu_quota,
cpu_period), disk IO(disk_read_bytes_sec,disk_write_bytes_sec etc.),
network bandwidth(vif_inbound_average, vif_outbouand_average) to "quota"
scope in extra_specs, so that it doesn't conflict with compute_capabilities_filter.
after this patch, user should use:

nova flavor-key m1.tiny set quota:cpu_shares=1000 to set parameters.

Fix bug #1146322

DocImpact

Change-Id: I30e550d21f00eb949ee2f3f8fb4d952c10bf8000

commit_message:
Don't log traceback on expected console error.

When requesting a console before an instance is read (while still
building) we will get an InstanceNotReady exception.  This exception is
raised in the compute manager.  The explanation in the exception will
include the traceback from the manager side.  If we use this as the
explanation, we end up with a traceback in the API log, even though it's
just an INFO log message.

Use a more basic explanation, which is accuately more consistent with
other cases of raising HTTP exceptions, which doesn't include a
traceback.

Fix bug 1154327.

Change-Id: Idca443165983289a0df40970f68f95d5550ce72a

commit_message:
Generalize console error handling during build.

There is a race condition where you can create an instance and then
quickly request a VNC or Spice console before the instance is ready.
The way this went down was different depending on the virt driver in
use.  The libvirt driver would raise InstanceNotFound.  The xenapi
driver would raise InstanceNotReady.

This patch moves the handling of this race that was in the xenapi driver
up to the compute manager.  Now, all of the virt drivers that support
this method (libvirt, xenapi, vmware) will all raise InstanceNotFound in
this case, and the compute manager will convert it into InstanceNotReady
IFF the vm_state is BUILDING.

Related to bug 1154327.

Change-Id: I68f4a6db8aac26c6f731c985d97299ee38c34448

commit_message:
Resize/Migrate refactoring fixes and test cases

This patch will fix the construction of an scp command to be joined on
spaces. Also adds a parameter in driver.finish_migration to
_create_lpar_instance(), some refactoring that needed to be done in
order to launch the instance on the destination host. This patch fixes
Bug #1153599. This patch also address the tests cases for resize/migrate
functionality for PowerVM. Bug #1133058 is for tracking these test cases

Change-Id: I86c1b697fe5c7d6e4a6c689f75fd5cf737cef5d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-04 22:06:02.000000000', 'message': "Remove TODO that didn't land in grizzly

This was intended to be removed during grizzly by utilizing centralized
policy storage on /v3/policies -- but such a feature hasn't been
implemented yet beyond the API.

Change-Id: Ie696bc671fc1d6fd05cc1dda376d2be945097845
"}]
commit_message:
Remove TODO that didn't land in grizzly

This was intended to be removed during grizzly by utilizing centralized
policy storage on /v3/policies -- but such a feature hasn't been
implemented yet beyond the API.

Change-Id: Ie696bc671fc1d6fd05cc1dda376d2be945097845

commit_message:
Do not return location in headers

In some cases credentials were being leaked when downloading a cached
v1 image.

Fixes bug 1135541, CVE-2013-1840

Change-Id: Ie4077470d31249c5bd654985fcef577f4f5cfc59

Test modified: test_get_metadata_of_alt_account_server_fails

Modifications:
As per new Tempest style guidelines, convert "try/expect/else"
statements into "assertRaises".

In order to ensure that other tests remain unaffected
because of this change, replace "finally" with "addCleanup".

Partially implements Blueprint update-expected-exception-tests.

Change-Id: I0b8be10c90111c5faa78a8955e0370fa558e7bfd
'}]
commit_message:
Convert try/expect/else as per new Tempest style.

Test modified: test_get_metadata_of_alt_account_server_fails

Modifications:
As per new Tempest style guidelines, convert "try/expect/else"
statements into "assertRaises".

In order to ensure that other tests remain unaffected
because of this change, replace "finally" with "addCleanup".

Partially implements Blueprint update-expected-exception-tests.

Change-Id: I0b8be10c90111c5faa78a8955e0370fa558e7bfd

Add a test to list the security group rules

* Create two rules for the security group.
* List the rules, there are created in the security group.

Fixes bug 1145626

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

commit_message:
add find_stack_traces tool

this is useful to go and collect all the stack traces found for a
particular test run. Helps us easily identify when stack traces
are being generated even on good runs.

Change-Id: Ia5b95be7bc1a425630fba06c7c65cbaa9fa7079f

Quota table creation/drop needs to be added. In Folsom release Quota tables is only created when quota extension is enabled.

In addition, my question is how to migrate Folsom version of DB. In Folsom deployment revision is None, so when we first run quantum-mange db_sycn upgrade the script try to upgrade from None to 4960853fd5ac (the initial version) and it will fail (since the tables exist). Perhaps I must misunderstand something.

Thanks,'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

Hi,
Looks good.
Just have a few minor inline comments and questions.
Another question - will the scripts need to be updated of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18684/ gets through?
One thing concerning me moving forward is the ability to ensure that someone adds the treatment when they make database changes.
Can we somehow cause tests to fail if one makes a db change without updating the migration code.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:26:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I have been able to enable versioning, upgrade, downgrade, and create revisions.

There are still some things I do not understand about the autogenerated templates, but that's something that's probably due to my dumbness.

For instance:
1) The script always ends up somewhere where the package is installed in /usr/local rather than in my working dir. If I try and run quantum-db-manage from the bin directory I get an import error.
2) I generated my template AFTER the new models were added to the mysql DB and for some reason the create_table ddl commands were in the downgrade routine
3) I then generated my template BEFORE the new models where added to the mysql DB and no DDL statement for my models was found.

Coudl this because the service_type upgrade, which I am doing - is not loaded by any core plugin (and hence I end up in the same situation as the quota extension?)"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-14 14:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

commit_message:
Add migration support to Quantum

implements blueprint quantum-db-upgrades

This changeset provide database migration capabilities to Quantum by
wrapping the Alembic library.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-12 20:48:45.000000000', 'message': 'fix(nose): Comment out detailed-errors to workaround a testtools+nose bug

Setting "detailed-errors=1" in setup.cfg causes a bug in testtools to
manifest.

Trigger: self.assertX(condition), where condition == False.

In "testtools/testresult/real.py" the traceback is set to
None in _details_to_exc_info(), but the inspect_traceback()
method in nose/inspector.py requires a traceback-like object.

Change-Id: Ia95fd2176ea0ccc984623b53b3536f995c6db5bb

commit_message:
fix(nose): Comment out detailed-errors to workaround a testtools+nose bug

Setting "detailed-errors=1" in setup.cfg causes a bug in testtools to
manifest.

Trigger: self.assertX(condition), where condition == False.

In "testtools/testresult/real.py" the traceback is set to
None in _details_to_exc_info(), but the inspect_traceback()
method in nose/inspector.py requires a traceback-like object.

Change-Id: Ia95fd2176ea0ccc984623b53b3536f995c6db5bb

commit_message:
Add gettext support

The patch adds gettext support to marconi. With it, it is now possible
to use `_` for defining i18n strings. (e.g: _("Super String"))

Implements blueprint storage-base

Change-Id: I96709bb4e0dbe5ec6c5497e7139366624a154272

commit_message:
Remove check for valid Origin for the "actual request".

The only place in the spec that I could see the Origin being checked was
during the pre-flight OPTIONS request. If it gets to the actual request
let auth decide. Please correct me if this is wrong.

Change-Id: Ic31b71746ec056091c7778ebff3db7becc32bd9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 21:36:41.000000000', 'message': 'Make auth_token lazy load the auth_version.

Updates recent changes to the auth_token middleware (this
is a regression in d782a99) so that self.auth_version is
lazy loaded.

This fixes issues where other openstack services would fail
to startup correctly if Keystone is not running. The issue
was auth_token was trying to make a request to '/' to get
versions information on startup to "autodetect" the correct
version to use.

This patch fixes startup issues by moving the version detection
so that it is lazy loaded right before it is actually used.

This issue should fix SmokeStack :)

Fixes LP Bug #1154806.

Change-Id: Ib24f5386fa1ffe0e0365548840f0cfeaae36f548
'}, {'created': '2013-03-13 21:59:07.000000000', 'message': 'Make auth_token lazy load the auth_version.

This patch fixes startup issues by moving the version detection
so that it is lazy loaded right before it is actually used.

This issue should fix SmokeStack :)

Fixes LP Bug #1154806.

Change-Id: Ib24f5386fa1ffe0e0365548840f0cfeaae36f548
'}]
commit_message:
Make auth_token lazy load the auth_version.

Updates recent changes to the auth_token middleware (this
is a regression in d782a99) so that self.auth_version is
lazy loaded.

This fixes issues where other openstack services would fail
to startup correctly if Keystone is not running. The issue
was auth_token was trying to make a request to '/' to get
versions information on startup to "autodetect" the correct
version to use.

This patch fixes startup issues by moving the version detection
so that it is lazy loaded right before it is actually used.

This issue should fix SmokeStack :)

Fixes LP Bug #1154806.

Change-Id: Ib24f5386fa1ffe0e0365548840f0cfeaae36f548

commit_message:
Make keystone client handle the response code 300.

Keystone discover command currently fails to list
the keystone server. Fix is
made such that client handle the response code
300 from the keystone server.

Fixes Bug #1136476

Change-Id: Iada31f1e274aade90aa4b4be2a136793a0ba64d7

commit_message:
Fix an error in affinity filters

Fix a call to compute_api.get_all to properly exclude deleted instances.
Add tests to prohibit this error in the future.

After some thought, this can be further optimized to let the instance
query do all the filtering/matching.

Resolves bug 1107156.

Change-Id: I6d6a6ba44d38d363489853d0407ad4cc94046656
(cherry picked from commit 8bc80cab3c134d64953b4f6493cab80b5bdc1b69)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-08 22:16:35.000000000', 'message': "Catch KeyError exception as early as possible when there is no matching data on the server.

When the server does not have any data matching the requested response_key, it can still return
successfully. A subsequent lookup in the returned data throws a KeyError exception. The simple
fix for this is to catch the KeyError exception and return an empty list. An empty list, rather
than None, is required because the calling code expects an iterable. The exception is caught
as early as possible after the server returns from the GET request. The end result is that the
CLI user sees an empty result when the requested data doesn't exist on the server. Prior to
this fix the keyError exception was propagated all the way to the user, causing a confusing
message to be printed. Also added associated unit test.

Fixes bug #1111972

Change-Id: I88ba658f8be7e7edf255ef9f7d83ba87f36f4efc
"}]
commit_message:
Catch KeyError exception as early as possible when there is no matching data on the server.

When the server does not have any data matching the requested response_key, it can still return
successfully. A subsequent lookup in the returned data throws a KeyError exception. The simple
fix for this is to catch the KeyError exception and return an empty list. An empty list, rather
than None, is required because the calling code expects an iterable. The exception is caught
as early as possible after the server returns from the GET request. The end result is that the
CLI user sees an empty result when the requested data doesn't exist on the server. Prior to
this fix the keyError exception was propagated all the way to the user, causing a confusing
message to be printed. Also added associated unit test.

Fixes bug #1111972

Change-Id: I88ba658f8be7e7edf255ef9f7d83ba87f36f4efc

First, I don't actually understand why we are symlinking at all. Anyone have history on that? Also, the symlink can't fail, it's a -f, so even if the source file isn't there, the symlink is going to exist.

[{'created': '2013-02-26 23:06:55.000000000', 'message': "Add some checks for screen creation and activity.

Cases of both screen session never starting,
and empty screen logs have been noted for a number
of services in the gate tests.

This patch adds a simple check on screen_it to make
sure that the screen session was launched by checking
for the SCREEN_LOGDIR file.

As a last step in stack.sh we also check the screen logs
and make sure they're not empty.  This doesn't fix
devstack bug 1133355, but it will help us detec it sooner
and avoid erroneous data collection due to assigning recheck
bugs to what appears to be the problem but isn't root cause.

Change-Id: I1193aea501a7babe27bdb4119fc85814bd04c0d0
NOTE:  This change ONLY works when using SCREEN_LOG_DIR setting

commit_message:
Add some checks for screen creation and activity.

Cases of both screen session never starting,
and empty screen logs have been noted for a number
of services in the gate tests.

This patch adds a simple check on screen_it to make
sure that the screen session was launched by checking
for the SCREEN_LOGDIR file.

As a last step in stack.sh we also check the screen logs
and make sure they're not empty.  This doesn't fix
devstack bug 1133355 per say, but it will help us detec it sooner
and avoid erroneous data collection due to assigning recheck
bugs to what appears to be the problem but isn't root cause.

I've also noticed the symlink creation fail on occasion, but
found that the screen session launched, I suspect there's a timing
issue here with screen generating it's log/output file and devstack
trying to create the symlink.  Added the 1.5 sleep after screen
kicks off to try and cover this.

Change-Id: I1193aea501a7babe27bdb4119fc85814bd04c0d0
NOTE:  This change ONLY works when using SCREEN_LOG_DIR setting

commit_message:
Set the version range for prettytable dependency

devstack has been failing to install because the
dependency for prettytable here is not fixed and
results in a newer version being installed than
the other projects allow.

Change-Id: Ieea8d9a62dfb5c511a30150fd678fe0b4b57d369
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

[{'created': '2013-02-26 05:42:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to launch services w/out screen.

This change is to test an idea of launching services in
devstack without using screen.

As an initial try, we try to do this with as minimal impact
and change as possible.  If we determine that this is useful and
we want to go this route long-term there's definitely some optimizing
and clean up that can and should be done.

As it stands right now, this patch just looks for a "NO_SCREEN=True"
variable to be set and if it's set to True, then rather than launch
in a screen session processes are launched using "bash -c".

Logs should be stored in the same format and in the same location as
the symlinks for the current gate runs.

Capturing pids in this case is a bit tedious, so for unstack we just
gather up pgrep resutls for each installed bin service
(ie "pgrep -f /opt/stack/*/bin) and kill all of the pids we find
in the results.

Change-Id: I19f84a248d1a636a8c3a15de85c1280bb7d2af5d
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to launch services w/out screen.

This change is to test an idea of launching services in
devstack without using screen.

As an initial try, we try to do this with as minimal impact
and change as possible.  If we determine that this is useful and
we want to go this route long-term there's definitely some optimizing
and clean up that can and should be done.

As it stands right now, this patch just looks for a "NO_SCREEN=True"
variable to be set and if it's set to True, then rather than launch
in a screen session processes are launched using "bash -c".

Logs should be stored in the same format and in the same location as
the symlinks for the current gate runs.

Capturing pids in this case is a bit tedious, so for unstack we just
gather up pgrep resutls for each installed bin service
(ie "pgrep -f /opt/stack/*/bin) and kill all of the pids we find
in the results.

Change-Id: I19f84a248d1a636a8c3a15de85c1280bb7d2af5d

Okay, so things are different now that this is a separate migration.

This is how my db looks after migration 19:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/33318/

If I run this migration I get an integrity error because you're inserting rows that already exist. It should be safe to assume that the rows already exist in the user_project_metadata table due to migration 17 (and they should already contain the CONF.member_role_id role). You need to add the roles from each row in the metadata table to the existing roles in the matching row in the user_project_metadata table."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-11 13:45:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Migrate roles from metadata to user_project_metadata

migration 017 did not migrate existing roles from the metadata table
that was created in 001. Adding a migration (20) that compares the roles
in the metadata table (if any) and joins them to the new
user_project_metadata role that matches the user and tenant from the old
table. Also adding subsequent tests to check both of the issues above.
bug 1131087

Change-Id: I00ea6043d949c9c358827e25f05c63515fe5dea8

commit_message:
Fix db upgrade set column from Null to "None".

DB migration 153 adds instance_type data to sys_meta, but if origonal value
of column "vcpu_weight" is Null, after migration, it changes to be a string
"None", wich can cause exception when calling instance_types.extract_instance_type.

This converts 'None'  to be Null.

Fix bug #1152546

Change-Id: I43644ade3b3cee34ef11d85c7c9c238beb90cd2c

commit_message:
Fix cells instance deletion

Instance delete and soft_delete are broken with cells when the API
doesn't know the cell of an instance.  A traceback occurs in all child
cells.  Also: soft_delete results in a 'hard' type being sent to
child cells vs 'soft'.

Fixes bug 1154333

Change-Id: I13ac839fa13a66caa100a3459bcc8e1183821ff1

commit_message:
Remove sqlalchemy calling back to DB API

sqlalchemy unnecessarily calls back to DB API in a few spots.  It's
more efficient to not do so.

Also, when dbapi_use_tpool is enabled, this causes a lock up due to an
eventlet bug.

Fixes bug 1154811

Change-Id: I5937a2dce85a09502f40ebcd99afb441938c1289

commit_message:
Force nova to use keystone v2.0 for auth_token

This is a workaround for bug 1154809 until cinderclient supports
v3 service catalogs or we have some workaround in place.

Change-Id: I832ef1735579b240a367c051c44f97b1619f8d3d

[{'created': '2013-03-12 21:33:56.000000000', 'message': 'List ConsoleTypeInvalid as a client exception.

get_vnc_console() and get_spice_console() in nova.compute.manager should
list ConsoleTypeInvalid as a client exception for rpc. This prevents the
rpc layer from logging a traceback for this exception when raised. It is
an expected type of exception that the client should be left to handle
how it would like.

Fix bug 1154301.

Change-Id: I3a359cbb4edbfabea1775e927b6f9947db26a284
'}]
commit_message:
List ConsoleTypeInvalid as a client exception.

get_vnc_console() and get_spice_console() in nova.compute.manager should
list ConsoleTypeInvalid as a client exception for rpc. This prevents the
rpc layer from logging a traceback for this exception when raised. It is
an expected type of exception that the client should be left to handle
how it would like.

Fix bug 1154301.

Change-Id: I3a359cbb4edbfabea1775e927b6f9947db26a284

This looks great. Should we update the tableargs for the ImageMember model in glance/db/sqlalchemy/models.py?

Right now it's 

  __table_args__ = (UniqueConstraint('image_id', 'member'), {})

I would expect all you need to do is add in 'deleted_at'"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-03-12 17:38:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@bcwaldon

I'm a bit confused by that proposed change to the model class.

I thought the purpose of the migrations was to allow schema changes to be introduced in a step-wise, reversible fashion.

Whereas if the unique constraint is changed in the model class also, I'm not sure how the downgrade would work cleanly (short of backing out the code change).

Have I missed something here?

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-03-12 22:54:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

We do not support live upgrades, so I'm not sure I see an issue with pairing a code change with a database migration. I'm also not sure how sqlalchemy would act in the case that we explicitly define the uniqueness constraint in the model as different than underlying reality. Additionally, if a new environment is stood up with this code and db_auto_create=True, the tables will be generated from the models and the db version will be set to whatever latest is, never having a chance to get the proper uniqueness constraint set up."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-12 23:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think the assumption for now is that while running a downgrade, you have exclusive access to the database.

So I believe Waldon is right, we should update the model as well.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-03-13 17:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-03-13 17:19:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

OK, getting this to work for an auto-created DB proved a bit awkward, as the model class was missing an index that would have been added had the Table been created in the normal way via the migrations.

This missing index proved problematic in a downgrade, as mysql apparently doesn't allow a unique constraint to be dropped if it involves a foreign key (image_id in this case) that doesn't also figure in another index.

Hence the addition of the missing Index to the model class also.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-13 17:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks, LGTM!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-13 18:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-12 15:52:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix uniqueness constraint on image_members table.

Fixes bug #1098700.

Previously, deleting then re-creating an image member failed with
500 ServerError due to the registry service failing to commit
the update to the image_members table.

The problem arose because the declared uniqueness constraint on that
table only spanned the image_id and member columns, but did not take
into account that deleted rows are left in situ with the deleted_at
and deleted columns set as appropriate. Hence the unique constraint
was violated by the addition of the new row.

We modify the uniqueness constraint to take account of the deleted_at
column also (NULL for live memberships).

Note that the new ability to recreate an image membership cannot be
be asserted in a functional test, as these tests are based on sqlite
which does not support 'ALTER TABLE DROP CONSTRAINT'.

Change-Id: I175801ba95ecd9295791bb12e9096f59efa19c02

commit_message:
Fix uniqueness constraint on image_members table.

Fixes bug #1098700.

Previously, deleting then re-creating an image member failed with
500 ServerError due to the registry service failing to commit
the update to the image_members table.

The problem arose because the declared uniqueness constraint on that
table only spanned the image_id and member columns, but did not take
into account that deleted rows are left in situ with the deleted_at
and deleted columns set as appropriate. Hence the unique constraint
was violated by the addition of the new row.

We modify the uniqueness constraint via a migration script to take
account of the deleted_at column also (NULL for live memberships).

Note that the new ability to recreate an image membership cannot be
be asserted in a functional test, as these tests are based on sqlite
which does not support 'ALTER TABLE DROP CONSTRAINT'.

Change-Id: I175801ba95ecd9295791bb12e9096f59efa19c02

update OpenStack, LLC to OpenStack Foundation

fixes bug 1154745

The previous update (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24103/) missed
header files that contained "OpenStack, LLC".  This change corrects the
missed files to reflect the OpenStack Foundation.

Change-Id: I9c6de265267485ef2c82ea7e6d8643e82134d102
(cherry picked from commit 65e3d8c9773880094c0a4c164e046fae9cb7a5d9)

[{'created': '2013-03-11 19:20:34.000000000', 'message': "Add duplicate bug detection to skip_tracker.py

Previously, if a tempest test was skipped because of a bug that
was marked a duplicate of another bug the skip tracker would not
check the status of the duplicate bug. This would cause fixed bugs
from being shown up in the list, because the original bug's status
is not necessarily updated if it is marked as a duplicate.

This commit fixes this behavior by checking if there is a duplicate
bug first. Then after all the bugs' statuses are checked the list of
duplicate bugs is checked. If a duplicate bug is marked as fixed the
original bug is added to list of bugs that is safe to unskip.

Change-Id: Ia1aaec9e01a97556d17b0640a95e03f0f0b37680
"}]
commit_message:
Add duplicate bug detection to skip_tracker.py

Previously, if a tempest test was skipped because of a bug that
was marked a duplicate of another bug the skip tracker would not
check the status of the duplicate bug. This would cause fixed bugs
from being shown up in the list, because the original bug's status
is not necessarily updated if it is marked as a duplicate.

This commit fixes this behavior by checking if there is a duplicate
bug first. Then after all the bugs' statuses are checked the list of
duplicate bugs is checked. If a duplicate bug is marked as fixed the
original bug is added to list of bugs that is safe to unskip.

Change-Id: Ia1aaec9e01a97556d17b0640a95e03f0f0b37680

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

commit_message:
Fix: Nova aggregate API throws an uncaught exception on invalid host

Add ComputeHostNotFound to the caught exceptions.

Resolves bug 1154138.

Change-Id: I385b88b85caf534f51db70577eb62361e8cc461f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 11:41:52.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Nova dependencies from hacking test

References to Nova in the docstrings(!) of the hacking.py tests caused the
run_pep8.sh script to fail if the Grizzly development version of Nova was
not installed. Update all the references to use Heat packages instead.

Change-Id: I2e84e9a231451705d61fa9acddc65ee95a98e294
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Nova dependencies from hacking test

References to Nova in the docstrings(!) of the hacking.py tests caused the
run_pep8.sh script to fail if the Grizzly development version of Nova was
not installed. Update all the references to use Heat packages instead.

Change-Id: I2e84e9a231451705d61fa9acddc65ee95a98e294

commit_message:
Don't load system_metadata when it isn't joined.

If we always load system_metadata, it will throw a sqlalchemy
error if it isn't joined in the column. Rather than putting it
in extra keys we need to explicitly join it if it is missing.

Adds a test to make sure that system_metadata is returned
properly from the migration call even though the extra keys
parameter was removed.

Fixes bug 1146000

Change-Id: I05365906ed528a06fe5704449dab72c857fefa65

commit_message:
fix(tox): Address warnings

* Remove "bash" from command string in testenv:pep8 to stop it from
  complaining about referencing something outside the virtualenv.
* Add missing pyflakes dependency

commit_message:
Add a region tier to Swift's ring.

The region is one level above the zone; it is intended to represent a
chunk of machines that is distant from others with respect to
bandwidth and latency.

Old rings will default to having all their devices in region 1. Since
everything is in the same region by default, the ring builder will
simply distribute across zones as it did before, so your partition
assignment won't move because of this change. If you start adding
devices in other regions, of course, the assignment will change to
take that into account.

swift-ring-builder still accepts the same syntax as before, but will
default added devices to region 1 if no region is specified.

Examples:

$ swift-ring-builder foo.builder add r2z1-1.2.3.4:555/sda

$ swift-ring-builder foo.builder add r1z3-1.2.3.4:555/sda

$ swift-ring-builder foo.builder add z3-1.2.3.4:555/sda

Also, some updates to ring-overview doc.

Change-Id: Ifefbb839cdcf033e6c9201fadca95224c7303a29

commit_message:
Declare index on ImageMember model

This index was added in migration 008. However, it was not on the model,
which meant any autocreated db would not have it.

Fixes bug 1154777

commit_message:
Fix check_003 method.

This commit fixes the check on migration 003 in test_migrations.
Previously, when this method was added it didn't check that the
data in the type column previously in the images table was moved
correctly into the image_properties table. This commit adds these
data checks.

Change-Id: Ia3906c8497218c8a3d2a13b0c99a6aa566977ed4

Mention keyring in test-requires as in python-keystoneclient.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-12 12:49:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix circular import in glance/db/sqlalchemy

Fix running test_migration solely.

api.py depends on models.py that depends on api.py.
Import statements in these files are such that api.py
must be imported before models.py. That's why usually
test_migrations doesn't fail when all tests are launched.
However, thus test_migration depends on test running order
making testing procedure unreliable, including parallel testing.

Move glance.db.sqlalchemy.api import to the only place
where it's required in models.py

Change-Id: Ib20dde8edd3473595aac1ca8bbaa5a0d3116a697
Fixes: bug #1154058
"}]
commit_message:
Fix circular import in glance/db/sqlalchemy

Fix running test_migration solely.

api.py depends on models.py that depends on api.py.
Import statements in these files are such that api.py
must be imported before models.py. That's why usually
test_migrations doesn't fail when all tests are launched.
However, thus test_migration depends on test running order
making testing procedure unreliable, including parallel testing.

Move glance.db.sqlalchemy.api import to the only place
where it's required in models.py

Change-Id: Ib20dde8edd3473595aac1ca8bbaa5a0d3116a697
Fixes: bug #1154058

commit_message:
Refactor work with session in db.block_device_mapping_* methods

Remove explicit use of session where it is not required.
Also this is small performance optimization, because if we put
session parameter to Models.save() method will create subtransaction.

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: I6064f3df2daf0178009c4cf40da293f71ca6972a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 17:28:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix use of potentially-stale instance_type in tenant_usage

The simple_tenant_usage API extension may return incorrect billing
information if a flavor is changed or deleted while an instance using
it is still running. This makes it use the stashed instance_type instead.

Fixes bug 1154707

Change-Id: Ifce33488e5ef8aa942051d882407a3e2d088aaf5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix use of potentially-stale instance_type in tenant_usage

The simple_tenant_usage API extension may return incorrect billing
information if a flavor is changed or deleted while an instance using
it is still running. This makes it use the stashed instance_type instead.

Fixes bug 1154707

Change-Id: Ifce33488e5ef8aa942051d882407a3e2d088aaf5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-12 20:40:38.000000000', 'message': 'Make run_instance() bail quietly if instance has been deleted

Right now, we make a big mess in the logs if someone deletes an
instance before we get a chance to run it. This cleans that up
to a single warning message.

Fixes bug 1154292

Change-Id: I2de0c2993d6a16d9482878eee4eef10bfd78c3e6
'}]
commit_message:
Make run_instance() bail quietly if instance has been deleted

Right now, we make a big mess in the logs if someone deletes an
instance before we get a chance to run it. This cleans that up
to a single warning message.

Fixes bug 1154292

Change-Id: I2de0c2993d6a16d9482878eee4eef10bfd78c3e6

commit_message:
Ensure tokens are revoked for relevant v3 api calls

A number of the v3 apis were not yet revoking tokens that would
be invalidated by their actions, including:

- grant/revoke role
- delete group
- add/remove user to group

A seperate bug has been rasied with regard to revoking tokens when
a role is deleted, since this needs much more plumbing to implement.

Fixes Bug #1093493

Change-Id: Icf0792821829045d5bdecf686ec470ce54f9c9af

commit_message:
update OpenStack, LLC to OpenStack Foundation

fixes bug 1154745

The previous update (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24103/) missed
header files that contained "OpenStack, LLC".  This change corrects the
missed files to reflect the OpenStack Foundation.

Change-Id: I9c6de265267485ef2c82ea7e6d8643e82134d102

commit_message:
Virtual Power Driver list running vms quoting error

This patch corrects a issue with VPD when configured for virsh the
list running vms function attempts to execute $2 instead of the actual
command.

Fixes Bug 1154280

Change-Id: I6d06cc58fb0f2935c4341761908b914106bda916
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

- http://logs.openstack.org/24256/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/8494 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24256/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/13722 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24256/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/8210 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-13 00:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Seems like this disallows authenticated CORS requests. Is that a legitimate use case?'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-13 02:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I hope not. Sharing your credentials with a browser seems like a bad idea. However, if you guys deem it is, please make this whole area optional so we can fix the regression where you can no longer save Origin header values.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-13 06:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm also cool if you guys want to patch this up to just "pass" with authed PUT and POST requests. I don't really know all that much about CORS, except that it's been a pain. ;) But this definitely broke saving the Origin header at change id I68538e472a900775427f21a8a59e738a83dcc8bc'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-03-13 08:13:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

One use case for authenticated CORS requests is an HTML5 user dashboard that does not proxy client requests to the cluster. In this case, it's sane for the token to be available to the CORS client.

Because of the way the CORS draft spec is written, the trigger for CORS processing starts with the Origin header being present. And so if Swift supports the Origin filtering, that conflicts with storing the origin header on a per-object basis.

I'm not sure of a middle path yet. One possibility may be to drop the origin header matching check (allowed by the spec). This would be functionally equivalent to making is_origin_allowed() always return True (although the patch would be different than that). This would remove user configuration, which is simpler (and therefore better) for the user, but it also is limiting.

I'd like other people's thoughts. I'd prefer removing the Origin header check over not allowing CORS on authenticated requests."}, {'account_id': 904, 'date': '2013-03-13 10:56:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So to summarise,
 * we must support clients setting the "Origin" header on objects
 * support for authenticated clients is up for debate

As John points out, according to the CORS specification the presence of the Origin header is what kicks off the Origin check. I don't believe that's optional.

While disabling the Origin header check would be an easy solution I'd be wary of the security implications. If we do this then I'd suggest we allow customers enable/disable CORS at the tenant level.

I'd be in favour of not allowing authenticated clients. I'm not sure I understand your use case John. I don't see why a HTML/Javascript dashboard would want to use authenticated requests. Wouldn't the dashboard use unauthenticated requests to talk directly to the Swift Proxy (or whatever's in front of it) since auth is done using tokens? The server from where the HTML/Javascript was retrieved may have used authenticated requests but in theory the Swift cluster would be at a different URL.

If a customer really wanted to use authenticated requests they could use a webserver/load balancer in front of the proxy to do the auth, strip out the "Authorization" header and forward the request to Swift.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-13 14:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-13 14:21:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Eh, one problem I just noticed is that things like TempURL set remote_user. The request isn't really authed, it's authorize_override = True. CORS+TempURL is definitely a use case. So I've changed this to differentiate between the two.

Now there's just a new flag, cors_check, that defaults to True and we'll set it false in our auth code. Solves our problem for backward compat and lets  everyone else do whatever they might want for their situations."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-13 15:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24256/2/check/gate-swift-pep8/1848 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24256/2/check/gate-swift-docs/1682 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24256/2/check/gate-swift-python26/1930 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/24256/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/8359 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 904, 'date': '2013-03-13 15:41:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Works for me.'}, {'account_id': 904, 'date': '2013-03-13 15:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Might be worth including a comment/doc to describe the purpose of this flag and why it was introduced.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-13 16:47:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, we've got a guy researching this stuff to see if saving the Origin header values even makes any bit of sense. Could be this was something dumb we did a couple years ago and backing away from it would be a Good Idea (TM)."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-13 20:50:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Dave's going to help out on this with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24362/"}]

(12 inline comments)

Hey :)

I'm sorry but I still don't buy it. I don't think that injecting stuff to the decorated classes is a good idea, I'd rather have an import of a "lazy loaded" config object.

Try adding more test cases and usage examples and explain this patch better in the commit message so that other people understand what this does.

@kurt could you chime in? If I'm the only one not liking this I'll definitely put more effort in figuring out the benefits of this implementation.

I'm not against the decoration stuff (I honestly don't see the real benefit, yet) but I don't think injecting methods to the decorated classes is what we want here. 

The whole idea of messing with the configs was about not passing it between classes. This patch does something completely different. I'm not against improving things, it's just that, right now, I don't see how we can benefit from this.'}, {'account_id': 6943, 'date': '2013-03-12 13:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (12 inline comments)

commit_message:
Decentralized configuration.

The configuration is based on oslo-config, while this module lets
each module which want to be configured define the options it need
by itself, and get the limited access to those config variables.

Implements blueprint config-module

Change-Id: Iffbb859da0cb5fb8434bc439320bf6c20f9d39b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 14:58:22.000000000', 'message': 'List ComputeHostNotFound as a client exception

service_get_all_by() in nova.conductor.manager should list
ComputeHostNotFound as a client exception for rpc. This to prevent
the rpc layer from logging a traceback when this exception is raised.
This is an expected type of exception that should be left to the
client to handle.

Resolves bug 1154597.

Change-Id: I656e264526673fa10e47692903a5f30f813b479b
'}]
commit_message:
List ComputeHostNotFound as a client exception

service_get_all_by() in nova.conductor.manager should list
ComputeHostNotFound as a client exception for rpc. This to prevent
the rpc layer from logging a traceback when this exception is raised.
This is an expected type of exception that should be left to the
client to handle.

Resolves bug 1154597.

Change-Id: I656e264526673fa10e47692903a5f30f813b479b

commit_message:
Removes tenant IDs checking for nova quota operations.

Until there is a way to validate tenant IDs, remove the existing checks.

Fixes bug #1154582

Change-Id: If10fac17b919190c1492cfbf1be9950284a82197

commit_message:
Add missing tests for db.block_device_mapping_* methods

There was no tests in test_db_api for block_device_mapping_* methods.
Add tests to ensure that all works. Also these tests allow us to refactor
work with session in these methods.

Fix bug in is_ephemeral we should return True or False not instance of
_sre.SRE_Match or None.

blueprint db-api-tests

Change-Id: I3cac17e7d2c8d0b2608fb9a78ea29210f025222b

commit_message:
Update to Quantum Client 2.2.0

This patch updates tools/pip-requires to use the python-quantumclient 2.2
It also limits the version to <3.0.0 to prevent breaking something accidently
when 3.0.0 is released.

Fixes bug 1152695

Change-Id: Ic47deccac1df5a1b6b5171f1f7d80b250b57ebc9

commit_message:
Added support for cert and key for external auth

Patched client to support passing certificates/key.  The client is able to do either
external auth ( via REMOTE_USER ) or username/password auth.

bug #1153839

Change-Id: I4153f7b36aa9d7f93f21578b3f48d716a9bbbe40

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 17:16:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary asserts from test_images.py

This commit removes unnecessary assertTrue()s from the tests in
CreateRegisterImagesTest test class in
tempest.tests.image.v1.test_images. The asserts were being used to
verify a particular field in the response, however this isn't
needed, because get() will throw an error if the key is invalid.
Additionally, for those types of test assertIn() should be used
instead of assertTrue(), but since they are unnecessary the asserts
are just removed.

Change-Id: I3bd24d48eb9bbc11f39d8077d1e823b10e34c6d9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary asserts from test_images.py

This commit removes unnecessary assertTrue()s from the tests in
CreateRegisterImagesTest test class in
tempest.tests.image.v1.test_images. The asserts were being used to
verify a particular field in the response, however this isn't
needed, because get() will throw an error if the key is invalid.
Additionally, for those types of test assertIn() should be used
instead of assertTrue(), but since they are unnecessary the asserts
are just removed.

Change-Id: I3bd24d48eb9bbc11f39d8077d1e823b10e34c6d9

[{'created': '2013-03-07 20:48:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add api version detection support to glance tests.

This commit adds support for detecting the api versions supported
by glance. The list of versions is aquired by making a GET
request on the glance endpoint. A new Image parent class for the
image clients is used to make the api call to get the list of

commit_message:
Add api version detection support to glance tests.

This commit adds support for detecting the api versions supported
by glance. The list of versions is aquired by making a GET
request on the glance endpoint.

A new get_versions method is added to rest_client which will make
a GET call on the base_url of the RestClient object. The method
parses the response from the api call to get the list of
versions. A check is then added to the base test classes to ensure
the api version being tested is in the list of supported api
versions.

Change-Id: If60bb509bc1b2c7ea514066d12e0a03a41308368

commit_message:
Fix behaviour of split_cell_and_item

If you try to split a cell and item, with no path!to!cell@ in it, it'll
now return None for the cell, instead causing a ValueError when trying
to split the result.

Change-Id: I228b9f3b0f63f8c7a6004b3206f5312ed2a878bc
Fixes: bug #1153841

commit_message:
Prepare services index method for use with cells

Move the api.openstack.compute.contrib.services' index method's logic
out of the openstack api layer and into the compute api layer.

The addition of the availability_zone information is already done by the
host api. For this reason it was removed from the openstack api layer.
The behaviour of the call remains the same, only the functionality has
been moved.

This patch makes the functionality automatically work in cells.

Work towards: bug #1150499

Change-Id: Ia9489f11608167aed5168ccb3b670f395f7de5f7

commit_message:
Disable test_rescued_vm_attach_volume

To fix bug 1126187, we are forbidding attach/detach in rescue mode.
Which test_rescued_vm_attach_volume explicitly checks for.

Change-Id: I745ccb9c7bc763809efd617eadfe5fd2fab1cb48

commit_message:
Log when image_size_cap has been exceeded

Add a log entry when an attempt to upload an image whose size is greater
than image_size_cap has been made.

Addresses bug 1154606.

Change-Id: I836cb2dad1c130c0df15d26a87229b60a6cc3033

(Aaron, bear with me while I ask tedious questions - you're a guinea pig for figuring out what questions we should be asking of all such requests)

What requires 2.2.0 instead of 2.1.2? What specific new APIs or semantics added between 2.1.2 and 2.2.0 is needed? Is it possible/worthwhile to continue to support 2.1.2 and only use the 2.2.0 features if its available?

Also, the rationale for capping to <3.0.0 is that quantumclient commits to API stability in the 2.x series? It won't break its API without updating the major number and it won't update the major number unless it needs to break its API"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-08 21:52:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

>(Aaron, bear with me while I ask tedious questions - you're a guinea pig for figuring out what questions we should be asking of all such requests)
Sure 

>What requires 2.2.0 instead of 2.1.2? What specific new APIs or semantics added between 2.1.2 and 2.2.0 is needed? Is it possible/worthwhile to >continue to support 2.1.2 and only use the 2.2.0 features if its available?

There was one api change that will require nova to have 2.2.0 (https://github.com/openstack/python-quantumclient/commit/77ea68e4527d41409f264286ae1cf296ab9152c2)


Horizon will also need it for the lbaas api change(https://github.com/openstack/python-quantumclient/commit/d514812c74ee32b45220145b2227a0f4dc129fc5)

2.2.0 also adds: 
*quota support for security groups (which nova/horizon don't integrate with yet)
* pagination (ditto)

>Also, the rationale for capping to <3.0.0 is that quantumclient commits to API stability in the 2.x series? It won't break its API without updating >the major number and it won't update the major number unless it needs to break its API
Correct"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-08 21:54:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The last answer is correct but my correct got line wrapped.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-12 21:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok, sounds like at least Nova and Horizon needs this version'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-03-13 19:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-13 19:06:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-13 19:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Update to Quantum Client 2.2.0

This patch updates tools/pip-requires to use the python-quantumclient 2.2
It also limits the version to <3.0.0 to prevent breaking something accidently
when 3.0.0 is released.

Fixes bug 1152695

Change-Id: I90e5118798ef2fca3b8b07acefe13336479d524f

commit_message:
Insure that migration 6 retains deleted image property index.

Migration 6 for sqlite deletes the entire table and then recreates it,
however it fails to create the image_properties deleted index.

Fixes bug: 1051123

Change-Id: I4740ff1d5b9ec44067e6af7dd822329105222690

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-12 09:36:44.000000000', 'message': "Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Unfortuantely '<0.8' matches '0.8.0b2', which is what we don't want.
Therefore pinning it to '<=0.7.99' instead.

Change-Id: I14eef50b5a423140421c6e8fe0a5242c2f676fa4
"}]
commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Unfortuantely '<0.8' matches '0.8.0b2', which is what we don't want.
Therefore pinning it to '<=0.7.99' instead.

Change-Id: I14eef50b5a423140421c6e8fe0a5242c2f676fa4

commit_message:
Add base classes for image tests.

This commit breaks out common functionality from the image test class
an moves it into a set of base classes. The base class also abstracts
out the create_image call and adds resource tracking. This way each
individual test class doesn't have to worry about cleaning up images
created for tests.

Change-Id: I55818f2565652cfffad5a66f44e1c7f81d73c5cf

commit_message:
xml_to_json should not convert xmlns into attribute

We should not treat xmlns as json payload.

Fixes LP# 1152630

commit_message:
Convert try/expect/else as per new Tempest style.

Test Modified: test_create_server_when_memory_quota_is_full.

Modifications:
As per new Tempest style guidelines, convert "try/expect/else"
statements into "assertRaises".

In order to ensure that other tests remain unaffected
because of this change, replace "finally" with "addCleanup".

Blueprint update-expected-exception-tests.

Change-Id: I5a4da788fcf8269d87e1d1e5c30bc8fdbef83aec

commit_message:
Use issublcass instead of isinstance

StorageBaseTest should check for issubclass instead of isinstance since
the driver / controller instances are not yet created at that time.

Fixes bug 1154690

Change-Id: I12a76305045cd7dfb8c98ece97e9e6c02e0b7622

commit_message:
Skip deleted fixed ip address for os-fixed-ips extension

Return the correct fixed ip address info when the address record(s)
marked 'deleted' in db.

Fixes bug 1152958

Change-Id: Ia2e63a7aeab2234be683ff507e7856d46601a9a8

commit_message:
Lazy load CONF.quota_driver.

nova.quota is imported before config options are parsed and it looks at
CONF.quota_driver on module-load.  This changes it so we look at
CONF.quota_driver post-module-load.

Fixes bug 1154371

Change-Id: Ia2e63a7aeab2234be683ff507e7856d46601a9a8

subject: Fix reconnecting to libvirt.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-13 15:11:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This approach is really doomed to failure in general since libvirt can change which error code is raised in a particular scenario at any release. This change isn't making life worse though, so I'll ACK it.

Libvirt >= 0.10.0 has support for triggering a formal event callback when a connection is lost. For the future, we should plan to use that in preference to this error check hack if we have new enough libvirt. Russell, can you clone the bug, so we can track the correct long term fix too."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-13 15:18:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 15:06:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix reconnecting to libvirt.

The right logic was in place for dealing with losing a connection to
libvirt and reconnecting.  However, it was observed that we actually get
VIR_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR, VIR_FROM_RPC after restarting libvirtd.  The
code is just updated to deal with INTERNAL_ERROR.

Fix bug 1154473.

Change-Id: Idf4abf3fe485cf534f1732e4340fc35652fec003
'}]
commit_message:
Fix reconnecting to libvirt.

The right logic was in place for dealing with losing a connection to
libvirt and reconnecting.  However, it was observed that we actually get
VIR_ERR_INTERNAL_ERROR, VIR_FROM_RPC after restarting libvirtd.  The
code is just updated to deal with INTERNAL_ERROR.

Fix bug 1154473.

Change-Id: Idf4abf3fe485cf534f1732e4340fc35652fec003

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 19:32:11.000000000', 'message': 'Honor metadata_encryption_key in glance domain

Since v2 is not using the registry client, it was not properly
encrypting image locations before storing them in the database. With
this change, the db layer in the glance domain now uses the metadata
encryption key as well.

To make this work, the declaration of the metadata_encryption_key option
had to move to glance.common.config to avoid circular module
dependencies.

Fixes bug 1128650

Change-Id: I3bb5da92ffda7bfe1bc064d11da8ecd4e6d9ab1d
'}]
commit_message:
Honor metadata_encryption_key in glance domain

Since v2 is not using the registry client, it was not properly
encrypting image locations before storing them in the database. With
this change, the db layer in the glance domain now uses the metadata
encryption key as well.

To make this work, the declaration of the metadata_encryption_key option
had to move to glance.common.config to avoid circular module
dependencies.

Fixes bug 1128650

Change-Id: I3bb5da92ffda7bfe1bc064d11da8ecd4e6d9ab1d
