commit_message:
Sync rpc from oslo-incubator.

Changes include:

 * Fix Copyright Headers - Rename LLC to Foundation
 * Preserve exceptions in impl_zmq.
 * Don't log a traceback on rpc call timeout.
 * Redis-based matchmaker
 * AMQP: skip duplicate messages
 * some other minor fixes / cleanups

Fix bug 1154232.

Change-Id: I8afb6b9a919fca34b4a93f7fad1551a023eba6b2

commit_message:
Catch and log server exceptions

Fixes bug 1133041

Exceptions from the keystone WSGI server can occur and not be logged.
This means keystone will appear to silently crash, so this change
catches these exceptions and logs them so the user can determine
the cause of the crash.

Change-Id: Iecc4b8062fa4e7dbe021627613412b5dfc635432

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

commit_message:
Implements base classes  for storage controllers

This patch follows (or should follow) the specs written in the v1
specification: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Marconi/specs/api/v1

This patch deletes driver_base.py and adds base.py in marconi/storage
package.

Note: Most of this implementations will be tested in further patches
since there's no good way to test these base classes.

Implements blueprint storage-base

Change-Id: Iefa6374635fcf9dd9fc60417d8ed5c306bbc619a

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

subject: Fix nova-manage --version
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-12 13:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

dims: this seems to work fine for me?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-12 13:41:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

dims points out that 'nova-manage version' includes version_info_with_package so the output of each will differ

I like this model:

 [markmc@sorcha ~]$ virsh --version
 0.9.11.4
 [markmc@sorcha ~]$ virsh version
 Compiled against library: libvir 0.9.11
 Using library: libvir 0.9.11
 Using API: QEMU 0.9.11
 Running hypervisor: QEMU 1.0.0

i.e. '--version' should just so the number and the 'version' sub-command can show more info"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-12 13:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

dan asked for sample output:

 [markmc@f17 nova]$ nova-manage version
 2013.1-0.9.g3.fc18
 [markmc@f17 nova]$ nova-manage --version
 2013.1'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-12 13:47:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd really like to see --version print out the full info, as 'version' command does. This info is useful for OS vendors who have to triage incoming bugs where the user may have just provided '--version' output."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-12 13:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24173/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/22709 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24173/1/check/gate-nova-docs/17130 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24173/1/check/gate-nova-python26/18539 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24173/1/check/gate-nova-python27/18628 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24173/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/8317 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/24173/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/9374 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-12 13:54:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

danpb: I think I'd expect '--version' to show the same thing across distros. I don't mind more detailed info being available from another command like 'nova-manage version'. Also, your argument applies equally to 'virsh --version' :)

But anyway, it's either no version or the simple version number for Grizzly since the full version number requires a cfg API change (an API change which I'm not even sure I like)"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-12 14:19:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Well if we have no choice, then we'll need to go for the simple version.

NB, the different virsh behaviour is not what we'd like to have. We unfortunately can't fix the 'virsh version' command to display the full 4-digit numbers due to the design of the APIs we're using there."}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-03-12 18:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

+1 for simple version in grizzles'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-03-12 18:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-13 12:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Approved

This has 2 core +2s, so approving to get it into rc1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-13 12:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Fixes bug #1138844

Pass the version kwarg to cfg.CONF() so that --version shows the
version number.

Change-Id: I589ebffec67ef00f8ba24f553bf3e81806aa50b6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-manage --version

Fixes bug #1138844

Pass the version kwarg to cfg.CONF() so that --version shows the
version number.

Change-Id: I589ebffec67ef00f8ba24f553bf3e81806aa50b6

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

commit_message:
Add Environment::OpenStack classifier

Doug had this registered for us:

  http://mail.python.org/pipermail/catalog-sig/2012-October/004634.html

It makes it easier to find all OpenStack packages.

Change-Id: I17ee76616eb11a02a65b7a624f625a207b9e9631

[{'created': '2013-03-13 07:00:57.000000000', 'message': "Don't directly pip install tempest pip-requires

This code:

    # Tempest doesn't satisfy its dependencies on its own, so
    # install them here instead.
    pip_install -r $TEMPEST_DIR/tools/pip-requires

causes us to do:

    Found existing installation: oslo.config 1.1.0
     Uninstalling oslo.config:

so rather than 1.1.0 installed, we end up with 1.1.0b1 and everything
goes kabloomy.

It looks like this comment came from a time (commit 9a352daf) before
tempest included proper install_requires (tempest commit 5abb253c3).

It should be safe to delete this and allow setup_develop() do all the
work just like the other projects.

Change-Id: I869f727900bb08c72e5e8f4e84858a9c77049715
"}]
commit_message:
Don't directly pip install tempest pip-requires

This code:

    # Tempest doesn't satisfy its dependencies on its own, so
    # install them here instead.
    pip_install -r $TEMPEST_DIR/tools/pip-requires

causes us to do:

    Found existing installation: oslo.config 1.1.0
     Uninstalling oslo.config:

so rather than 1.1.0 installed, we end up with 1.1.0b1 and everything
goes kabloomy.

It looks like this comment came from a time (commit 9a352daf) before
tempest included proper install_requires (tempest commit 5abb253c3).

It should be safe to delete this and allow setup_develop() do all the
work just like the other projects.

Change-Id: I869f727900bb08c72e5e8f4e84858a9c77049715

commit_message:
nova-manage: fix sub-command argument processing

Last but not least, current implementation adds a 'action_args' argument to
every sub-command which takes multiple optional arguements (nargs='*'), this
doesn't make sense since each sub-command defines what arguments they need,
there's no need to add an additional general action_args.

This patch does following to fix issues mentioned above:

 * change the way nova-mange to retrieve arguments of sub-commands;
 * remove general 'action_args';

Fixes bug #1092605

Change-Id: I4360d5b9ec6df2246a6b963b296b11de3536e127

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-08 11:05:41.000000000', 'message': "nova-manage: add 'required=True'

Add 'required=True' to those required arguments while keeping double dash.

The legacy implementation added double dash '--' to every argument of
sub-commands. To remain compatible of this (i.e. legacy automation scripts
based on nova-manage), after converting to OSLO's cfg, which is based on
python argparse module, double dash remains.
However, current implementation doesn't distinguish required/optional
arguments of sub-command, but instead using a late-check
(cliutils.validate_args()) to verify if enough parameters have been supplied
before executing the commands.  While this does prevent invalid input of
arguments but the out-put after detecting a missing argument problem isn't
helpful at all.  A easier and elegant way is to make arguement declaration
correct, then argparse will verify input for us and prompt meaningful error
message.  What's more, treating every argument as optional (that's how
argparse sees the arguments) makes help message very very confusing. Last
but not least, current implementation adds a 'action_args' argument to every
sub-command which takes multiple optional arguements (nargs='*'), this
doesn't make sense since each sub-command defines what arguments they need,
there's no need to add an additional general action_args.

Remove cliutils.validate_args() since it's not needed anymore.

Fixes bug #1092605

Change-Id: I35ff33dca7851cfe697f1d7582ad42230d8c0ff6
"}]
commit_message:
nova-manage: add 'required=True'

Add 'required=True' to those required arguments while keeping double dash.

The legacy implementation added double dash '--' to every argument of
sub-commands. To remain compatible of this (i.e. legacy automation scripts
based on nova-manage), after converting to OSLO's cfg, which is based on
python argparse module, double dash remains.
However, current implementation doesn't distinguish required/optional
arguments of sub-command, but instead using a late-check
(cliutils.validate_args()) to verify if enough parameters have been supplied
before executing the commands.  While this does prevent invalid input of
arguments but the out-put after detecting a missing argument problem isn't
helpful at all.  A easier and elegant way is to make arguement declaration
correct, then argparse will verify input for us and prompt meaningful error
message.  What's more, treating every argument as optional (that's how
argparse sees the arguments) makes help message very very confusing. Last
but not least, current implementation adds a 'action_args' argument to every
sub-command which takes multiple optional arguements (nargs='*'), this
doesn't make sense since each sub-command defines what arguments they need,
there's no need to add an additional general action_args.

Remove cliutils.validate_args() since it's not needed anymore.

Fixes bug #1092605

Change-Id: I35ff33dca7851cfe697f1d7582ad42230d8c0ff6

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

commit_message:
Sanitize input before creating IPC socket.

Sockets are created by the zeromq driver
for the topic specified by each incoming message.

Because the topic is arbitrarily supplied by the sender,
path separators in the topic must be illegal.

Fixes bug 1122763

Change-Id: Iccdb9b69e646bfe7665ee34c367fd4019db25f17

commit_message:
Fix bugs for Huawei driver

This fixes two bugs for Huawei iscsi driver.
(1)If firstly we map LUN 1(just not LUN 0) to host,we can also
find LUN 0 mapped,whose device path is '-'.Then we will failed
to map a real LUN 0.So,we avoid mapping LUN 0 to host by setting
every volume's host LUN ID larger than 0,instead of generating it
automatically.
(2)Check valid size of resource pools when creating snapshot and
make sure it larger than 1 GB.

Fixes bug: 1135618
Fixes bug: 1136980
Change-Id: I412e78bf84c95cb51431c45cc084e9ec6a8efb78

commit_message:
First havana commit.

This commit indicates that the master branch has moved on to
representing the "havana" release.  The previous commit will be use to
start the milestone-proposed branch for grizzly.

All future changes for grizzly must first be merged
into master, and then back-ported to a grizzly milestone-proposed branch
(or once grizzly is released, the stable/grizzly branch).

Change-Id: Ic2fadf815fd13d8c3d0afbc6493f8cd3ea6545d2

Before this change, image_member_find was not paying any attention to

commit_message:
Fix visibility on db image_member_find

Before this change, image_member_find was not paying any attention to
whether or not the requesting context was authorized to view the image
memberships. With this change, image membership results are always
limited to either images owned by the context tenant, or images shared
with the context tenant.

Fixes bug 1114821

Change-Id: I9cabe218429e32c7e2db932ced141e056e10d1c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-10 09:59:25.000000000', 'message': 'Convert run_tests.sh to use tox

Previously run_tests.sh is calling nosetests and handles virtual
environment directly. One of the major issue for using nosetests
directly is it is _not_ able to handle tests that requires installation
(e.g. tests against entry points related stuff).  Tox is a perfect
solution for this case in that it will always install package into
virtual environment (no matter --site-packages is true or false)
and then run tests.

This patch will convert run_tests.sh to use tox while maintaining
(almost) the same CLI interface to end-users.

Change-Id: Ic7169454608f10f9568baddc207b5ac0cf764106
'}]
commit_message:
Convert run_tests.sh to use tox

Previously run_tests.sh is calling nosetests and handles virtual
environment directly. One of the major issue for using nosetests
directly is it is _not_ able to handle tests that requires installation
(e.g. tests against entry points related stuff).  Tox is a perfect
solution for this case in that it will always install package into
virtual environment (no matter --site-packages is true or false)
and then run tests.

This patch will convert run_tests.sh to use tox while maintaining
(almost) the same CLI interface to end-users.

Change-Id: Ic7169454608f10f9568baddc207b5ac0cf764106

commit_message:
Handle IOError

Avoid unhandled exception when client closes
the connection prematurally.

Implements: blueprint wsgi-application-interface
Change-Id: I6c54c6d7ad004b51dbcf9996268180f65ac96803

commit_message:
WIP: Add JSONSchema's to represent hash versions of our currently supported record types.

These make use of a slightly newer version of JSONSchema that we currently use, so the syntax is a little different.

Change-Id: I3093fe5a06a71c0326109931fbb238101b8fcf58

commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Change-Id: Iea57598698b4faf906e82a2974497221d07f4d16

commit_message:
Ensure port get works when NVP mapping not stored in Quantum DB

Bug 1153616

If the entry for the mapping between a quantum and a NVP port identifier
is not found in the Quantum DB, search the port on NVP, and, if found,
add the mapping entry.
This ensures upgraded folsom databases keep working with Grizzly code.

Change-Id: I74943e8271f522dcd21c1c34b0159dd61bb66e76

[{'created': '2013-03-13 04:44:12.000000000', 'message': 'port_security migration does not migrate data

The port security migration previously created the correct table structure but
it did not migrate the old data into this table. This patch adds code that
copies the id fields from networks and ports into portsecuritybindings
and networksecuritybinds tables.

One thing to note is that in grizzly when a port is created on a network that
has port_security_enabled=True the port will also be created with
port_security_enabled=True since ports in NVP were not previously
created with the mac/ip security address pairs we have to set existing ports
and networks port_security_enabled value to be False. One could easily
write a script to do this after applying this migration to change the values
to port_security_enabled=True.

Fixes bug 1153366

Change-Id: I8a1ccab3e432c23c475816111d388df7f81b8e4a

commit_message:
port_security migration does not migrate data

The port security migration previously created the correct table structure but
it did not migrate the old data into this table. This patch adds code that
copies the id fields from networks and ports into portsecuritybindings
and networksecuritybindings tables.

One thing to note is that in grizzly when a port is created on a network that
has port_security_enabled=True, the port will also be created with
port_security_enabled=True. But since ports in NVP were not previously
created with the mac/ip security address pairs we have to set existing ports
and networks port_security_enabled value to be False. One could easily
write a script to set these values to True after applying this migration.

Fixes bug 1153366

Change-Id: I8a1ccab3e432c23c475816111d388df7f81b8e4a

commit_message:
Delete instance metadata when delete VM

* like everything else instance metadata is just soft deleted.
* This doesn't soft delete instance_system_metadata (bug 1153827)

Fix bug 1092408

Change-Id: Iebc2c7e055a110e5067829569127a272a1a92a87

commit_message:
websockify 0.4 is busted

This was just released and it is broken, stalling our gates.  When
attempting to install it, we get:

"error: can't copy 'include/util.js': doesn't exist or not a regular
file"

Change-Id: I9d93bff92cc4a9d837382acce78bff587f52fb99

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-12 13:16:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Managers that incorrectly derive from SchedulerDependentManager

Change conductor and network managers to be ordinary managers. Also
remove some unnecessary imports from managers already declared with
base manager classes in nova/manager.py.

Resolves bug 1154070.

Change-Id: I6b87cd5d7d5ef66425d084db667a6eff247cf0b1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: Managers that incorrectly derive from SchedulerDependentManager

Change conductor and network managers to be ordinary managers. Also
remove some unnecessary imports from managers already declared with
base manager classes in nova/manager.py.

Resolves bug 1154070.

Change-Id: I6b87cd5d7d5ef66425d084db667a6eff247cf0b1

commit_message:
Add sample configuration files for mod_wsgi

These files really only work for a devstack setup,
but the demonstrate what one would need to do in
a real deployment behind mod_wsgi.

Change-Id: If60ce2aa0b89c055ccc0411aece28042b14ab633
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

the 'publicize_image' policy as expected.

Replace it with a new test 'test_add_publize_image' which
performs the check as expected and verifies both authorized and
unauthorized code paths.

Fixes bug 1153670.

commit_message:
Fix up publicize_image unit test

The 'test_add_public_image_unauthorized' unit test wasn't checking
the 'publicize_image' policy as expected.

Replace it with new tests 'test_add_publicize_image_authorized' and
'test_add_publicize_image_unauthorized' which perform the check as
expected and verify both authorized and unauthorized code paths.

Fixes bug 1153670.

Change-Id: Ib095763a246df6aa16e1310f25b7a0d442229f1a

commit_message:
Use a non-standard port for the test server

Start the test API server on a non-standard port to avoid
conflicting with a server already running due to devstack.

Change-Id: I010c76376048e3433301ccc64ce35db11e69a3e7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Retain migration 12 indexes for table image_properties with sqlite.

The upgrade from migration 11 to 12 for sqlite fails to create the
existing indexes when it recreates the image_properties table.

Fixes bug: 1152386

Change-Id: I2ceba3d9c5c45f40564af12fa48c4efba1467021

commit_message:
Add l3 db migration for plugins which did not support in folsom

Bug 1153585

Several plugins added l3 support in the grizzly release. This means that
when upgrading from the folsom data model, the relevant data model changes
should be applied.
In order to do so this patch refactors the initial migration in order
to be able to reuse the upgrade_l3 and downgrade_l3 routines.

Change-Id: I876f6d637665e10fb09d2084bb8a545ce469fbf3

commit_message:
Fixes error message formatting in Load Balancers panel

Strings were formatted to contain a "%s" to be updated when
the message was used.

The resulting string in the message box was:
    Error: Unable to add Pool "%s".

The update routine that already existed and was not being called.
Calls to the existing routine are now being made.  Other places
the strings were changed as the name would not be in context any
longer and the unused methods removed.

Fixes: bug #1152719

Change-Id: I157531a1b65dc73ce4ff1a57079fb4a2fcb9f62e

commit_message:
Fix calls to image_member_find in tests

A few tests of image members in v2 were passing invalid arguments to
image_member_find. This problem showed up in a later patch where
image_member_find actually tries to make use of the context it was
passed.

Change-Id: I0611db9bf83ebf262e9d2a0ef33c805d23658f2a

commit_message:
update.py: support one-module-per-line configuration

Fixes bug #1122701

Allow:

  module=foo
  module=bar

rather than

  modules=foo,bar

to make reviewing changes easier.

Change-Id: Ic0a7fb28fd34f530c93806a5fb79ed3dc3bc494e

"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-06 07:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-06 08:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/22335 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/2/check/gate-nova-pylint/9152 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-03-06 19:54:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

While I understand you're trying to workaround the timeouts that make finding bad volumes slow, I just don't like passing information through Exceptions like that.  Other than the slowdown what issues would there be with creating a self.driver.find_bad_volumes() method that could be called when the exception is thrown?  I know it performs the work twice, but that can be optimized later if necessary."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-06 21:32:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Alaski:

Thanks for the comments. Completely agree that using an exception here is a bit dubious (I had to hold my nose while I wrote it). I'm not convinced that it's the best solution, but the other methods I examined were bad as well, so I settled on this one.

Some of the other ideas explored:

Explicit Virt-level call for cleanup (e.g. fix_broken_volumes):

THe problem with this is it requires a lot of interaction between the virt-layer and the compute-layer. It's not as simple as a single call to clean-up because several steps need to occur in succession, namely:

1. Try reboot and detect failure
2. Figure out which volumes are broken
3. Detach these volumes in the virt-layer
4. Retry VM operation
5. Detach volumes at API-layer (Cinder, BDM)

This kind of back-and-forth between compute and virt seemed not only complex but extremely error-prone.

For that reason I abandoned it in favor a different idea: What if the VM operation was guaranteed to complete successfully in the face of bad volumes but had the side-effect of detaching if necessary. This would mean we could call `driver.reboot` like normal (simple!) and then we just need some signaling that the a `detach` occurred.

The next question was how to signal:

One idea is to signal by using a return code. For example we could just return a dictionary that contains side-effect info (detached volumes or detached networks).

The downside, though not big, is that `driver.reboot` now has a return value whereas before it didn't.

The approach I went with instead was to leave `reboot` has return-value less, and just bundle the side-effect info into an exception which could be caught by any compute-manger operation where bad-volumes are known to be an issue (reboot for now, others later).

Are there other approaches I'm missing?

Is the return-value or explicit-API call approach preferable here?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-06 22:03:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

What about passing a callback method to driver.reboot() ?  Not sure how that fits, but I'll throw it out there."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-03-06 22:08:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

Removing the -1 to not scare away potential lookers.  I realized that my suggestion won't work because the bad volumes would be detached and not found on a second pass."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-06 22:12:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Chris: That doesn't sound too bad.

I guess compute could pass in a closure (necessary b/c it needs access to `context`) that the virt-layer could call after cleanup of bad volumes. Maybe something like:

def cleanup_bad_volumes(bad_devices):
   volume_ids = map_device_to_vol(bad_devices)
   for volume_ids in volume_ids:
      cinder.detach()
      bdm.destroy()
]
reboot(context, instance, on_bad_volumes=cleanup_bad_volumes)"}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-03-07 14:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

I understand the need for this, but I think that we should be able to get a slightly better fix.

I'm avoiding a -1 on this because I don't feel strongly that this is "the wrong" solution - but I would very much like more investigations to see if we can reduce the 120s delay.  I'm of course happy to help looking into this and can have a look in a couple of days (depending on urgency of course)'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-07 17:09:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Bob: Yeah this is definitely a hack.

The 120 sec delay sucks, but on the plus side, we only hit that in the rare-event that we actually have a bad volume; otherwise this code runs fast.

I think we can wait a couple of days to see if a better fix is out there, but otherwise, I'd just assume get this in and then rip it out later once we have got a real solution in hand."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-03-07 17:44:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Though I dislike the approach, as I think we all do, it's not worth leaving a bug open because there's no elegant solution.  But, as per http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-February/005979.html I would at least like to see some TODOs and bugs opened for an eventual fix."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-08 01:30:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-08 01:35:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This version of the code takes the callback route.

You can see, it modifies quite a few more files, and in some ways is more complex, but the benefit is it's not misusing exceptions as general-purpose signals.

AlaskI: I added a TODO with a bug ref to track Citrix's work on fixing the underlying timeout."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-08 02:15:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/3/check/gate-nova-pep8/22421 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/3/check/gate-nova-docs/16869 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/3/check/gate-nova-python26/18283 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/3/check/gate-nova-python27/18366 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/7689 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/7405 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/12802 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23662/3/check/gate-nova-pylint/9216 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-03-08 09:32:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think this is a significantly better approach - so would have +1'ed it if Jenkins didn't complain!"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-08 18:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-08 19:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

This looks pretty good as a callback.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-03-11 10:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

I think this looks like a good short term fix.

Just wondering about a few issues. I think we are mostly OK, but just wanted to double check a few things.

We only do this check on reboot. What about during spawn when you have root disk as a failed volume? During migrate/resize, I guess it would fail starting on the destination, and fail starting on the old host too?

The user will reboot their VM, and a volume will "magically" get disconnected. I am not sure this is great, but without any more instance states, I am not sure we can do any better. Maybe this is an edge case that is worth looking at in the UI, and/or documenting somewhere in the API spec?

Maybe cinder should have a special state for this case? An error of a failed attach? Is it likely to work next time? Maybe just a warning that is dismissed if you delete or try to attach again?'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-11 18:13:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> We only do this check on reboot. What about during spawn when you have root disk as a failed volume? During migrate/resize, I guess it would fail starting on the destination, and fail starting on the old host too?

Thanks for mentioning this. To keep this patch focused on fixing a specific bug, I decided to only handle the reboot case with the idea that we could follow up with a set of patches to handle the other cases as well. (I should create some bugs for that so that work doesn't get lost.)

That said, based on how this is implemented, the other cases should 'half-work'. By that I mean, we never call `VM.start` explicitly, we only use the wrapper method `_start` which has the detach broken volumes code in it.

This means that VM's should always be able to start.

The only thing we need to do for the other methods is make sure it's a *consistent* detach, meaning that we signal to the higher-layers via the callback that the detach occurred so we can destroy the BDM record and detach in Cinder. This should be a relatively straightforward addition.

> The user will reboot their VM, and a volume will "magically" get disconnected. I am not sure this is great, but without any more instance states, I am not sure we can do any better. Maybe this is an edge case that is worth looking at in the UI, and/or documenting somewhere in the API spec?

Yeah it's not ideal, but it's probably the best we can do at this point. I think the alternative of async-errors w/ user-directed recovery is probably a ways off (and maybe not even the right way to go in this situation).

> Maybe cinder should have a special state for this case? An error of a failed attach? Is it likely to work next time? Maybe just a warning that is dismissed if you delete or try to attach again?

Yeah I think is basically broaching the whole topic of how do we deliver async-errors to the user and let them recover from them. Hopefully we can get some good discussion of this at the summit.

This is something we added to CloudServers first-gen and turned out to be fairly tricky. I'd love to see if we could get some more elegant approaches proposed.'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-03-11 18:19:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Saw John's comment about boot from volume.  Since it could be a transient network disconnection, does it make sense to periodically retry to see if the volume becomes available again?

Perhaps use the callback to periodically try to scan the bad volume(s) and reattach them when they become available?"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-11 18:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-11 18:38:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Saw John's comment about boot from volume. Since it could be a transient network disconnection, does it make sense to periodically retry to see if the volume becomes available again?

Hmm, even if it is a transient network outage, we still would want the reboot to complete in a reasonable amount of time or give up, right?

Right now that reasonable amount of time is hard-coded as 120secs, but Citrix maybe be able to expose that timeout to Nova so that we could configure it to anything we want.

I don't know if a separate retry-loop would buy us much (unless I'm missing something here!)"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-03-11 18:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
xenapi: Fix reboot with hung volumes

If a volume becomes inoperable (e.g. the ISCSI connection is severed)
and the user goes to reboot, the instance may enter a permanently halted
state.

The root cause is that a VBD that points to 'bad' volume prevents VM
operations ('reboot', 'start') from completing under XenServer.

The work around is to detect which volumes are bad, detach in the
virt-layer, retry the operation (or in the case of reboot, just 'start'
the halted instance), and then notify the compute manager via a
callback so it can detach the volume in Cinder.

Fixes bug 1148614

Change-Id: Id4e8e84bb5748cfa267c2a418f9405fd86829e8f

commit_message:
Quantum: use generic VIF driver

For plugins that support VIF bindings, make use of the
LibvirtGenericVIFDriver libvirt vif driver. The plugin
returns the VIF type to Nova which inturn "knows" what
to do.

Change-Id: I82982a9f1324db878439aa6bbee38bd205f073d0

commit_message:
quantum lbaas agent support

Support for quantum lbaas reference implementation.

to test:
enable-service q-lbaas
Q_SERVICE_PLUGINS=
quantum.plugins.services.agent_loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin

Change-Id: If6f960436fa756ceea2f1f131113a56c0a41bc23

commit_message:
Fix detection of deleted networks in DHCP agent.

The DHCP-agent uses an in-memory networks cache to find out which networks must
be deleted and which ones must be updated. In a case of agent restart the networks
cache is empty and it's not possible to cleanup DHCP-processes serving networks
which were deleted while the DHCP-agent was down. The proposed fix fills the networks
cache when the agent starts using a list of networks which have existing config files.

Fixes: bug #1135948
Change-Id: I27758389755cd19bca9fdbeda9cc1a123370f527

(3 inline comments)

Agreed that deletes should be committed on the manager side to reduce resource racing.

Some comments and questions inline."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-11 16:24:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

Replies inline.  Essentially:  There's all sorts of problems.  At least for the delete case, this is the best we can do without some significant changes.  (I do have an issue to address with soft_delete, though.  But I don't know -- do soft deletes count against your quota or not? :)"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-03-11 17:39:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

I definitely agree this is a good short-termm, low risk improvement.  

Just thinking out loud here, but I wonder if in the future some kind of quota "journal" detailing the list of quota operations would be useful.  Possibly give each reservation a unique keys identifying the operation and resource to avoid creating multiple reservations for the same operation.

Then in the event of sync issues an audit could fix the usages by inspecting the database for the tenant's current usage and then playing back the journal.

Or is there already a mechanism to repair quota usage that I am not seeing?'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-11 17:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The current mechanism to repair quota is to set quota_usages.in_use=-1 for every resource.  That causes a re-sync on the next reservation call.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-11 17:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

But ya, I dunno what we should do in the future.  It feels like we do need some sort of tracking of exactly what is being included in the quota counts.  The old quota code used to do this...   That code was replaced because it was racey.  That old model may be better... I think it could be done without races.  But I dunno, requires a lot more thinking than I want to do right now! ;)'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-11 19:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-11 20:11:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-03-11 20:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

the quotas on the API side... no matter what happens on the manager
side.  We should only commit quotas when instances are actually marked
as deleted.  Any reservations should be rolled back if an error occurs.

(Partially?) Fixes bug 1098380

commit_message:
Fix quota issues with instance deletes.

In order to keep quotas in sync as much as possible, only commit quota
changes for delete when:

1) An instance's vm_state is updated to be SOFT_DELETED.
2) The DB record is marked as deleted (and the instance's vm_state is
   not SOFT_DELETED)

If a host is down and we delete the instance in the API, this means
quotas are committed within the API.  Otherwise, quotas are committed
on the manager side.

Fixes bug 1098380

Also needed for proper testing: Fixed compute cells tests so that pseudo
child cells use NoopQuotaDriver.  This uncovered inconsistencies in the
NoopQuotaDriver wrt the DBQuotaDriver.  Those issues were fixed as well.

Change-Id: Ib72de1a457f0c5056d55a5c7dd4d8d7c69708996

commit_message:
Compile BigInteger to INTEGER for sqlite

Ensure BigInteger does not map to BIGINT for an auto-created
sqlite registry DB, as this type is not supported by sqlite.

Refactoring a test to use generic unsupported column type

Fixes bug 1147879

Change-Id: I590c798dd470def286802bc6e00bb4b621332b8d

[{'created': '2013-03-08 18:11:33.000000000', 'message': 'Update to Quantum Client 2.2.0

This patch updates tools/pip-requires to use the python-quantumclient 2.2
It also limits the version to <3.0.0 to prevent breaking something accidently
when 3.0.0 is released.

Fixes bug 1152695

Change-Id: I98ea99bbc0dc5d5d4c67e5f8ae6b6c9f81fe2c4c
'}]
commit_message:
Update to Quantum Client 2.2.0

This patch updates tools/pip-requires to use the python-quantumclient 2.2
It also limits the version to <3.0.0 to prevent breaking something accidently
when 3.0.0 is released.

Fixes bug 1152695

Change-Id: I98ea99bbc0dc5d5d4c67e5f8ae6b6c9f81fe2c4c

commit_message:
Fixes uncaught exception on Add Pool when unable to retrieve networks

Variable instantiated in a try block referenced outside even when
exception happens in the api call that instantiates the variable.

Fixes: bug #1153736

Change-Id: I75d11f42f30621e9be61aaeef64ebe181fad1bf0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-12 19:17:45.000000000', 'message': "Fixed bug with account_info

There was a bug where account_info wasn't converting the
container_count value to an int. Causes max container count cap to
get hit pretty quick since '0' > 0.

Change-Id: Ibfc6eebbff5a00aaebb47e9731dd053b60e3caa4
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed bug with account_info

There was a bug where account_info wasn't converting the
container_count value to an int. Causes max container count cap to
get hit pretty quick since '0' > 0.

Change-Id: Ibfc6eebbff5a00aaebb47e9731dd053b60e3caa4

commit_message:
Adds Grizzly migration revision

fixes bug 1154255

This change adds a no-op migration called grizzly.  Deployers can reference
the symbolic name when updating their databases from Folsom.

Change-Id: I442586f1efdb52b7ec8b318077ace52f570b3ae4

commit_message:
Revert API changes in "Unify Manager._update behaviour"

This revert some of commit 63073104665ee4597cf3b7aa8dc2295a8a7db794,
specifically the changes made to the API since those changes were
never merged in Nova.

Resolves bug 1145768.

Change-Id: I8f83c5a33cfed0c3a659f5221b8b2e730ca9463f

commit_message:
Revert NestedStack FnGetRefId changes

This partially reverts commit e376c83cbd57c0720336848e4b82e3b7b804a347.

Allow StackResource to set the resource_id, since it will be the one
retrieving the stack using it.

Fixes bug #1154202

Change-Id: I2140afb4e9bf89b4eb73e45f4ef5974df98e87e1

[{'created': '2013-03-12 19:27:45.000000000', 'message': 'Correctly translate all branches/tags/shas:

The code which raises an error if two elements try
to install different versions of the same git repo
currently works correctly for SHAs, or if a branch
is specified first, followed by a SHA.

However it fails if two branches are specified, because
the shallow clone does not fetch all branch heads.

This change correctly handles any combination of
SHAs/branch-heads/tags.

Change-Id: I501e94150ddeb41b79588816576a5d7a06fa92aa
'}, {'created': '2013-03-12 19:27:45.000000000', 'message': 'Correctly translate all branches/tags/shas:

The code which raises an error if two elements try
to install different versions of the same git repo
currently works correctly for SHAs, or if a branch
is specified first, followed by a SHA.

However it fails if two branches are specified, because
the shallow clone does not fetch all branch heads.

This change correctly handles any combination of

Change-Id: I501e94150ddeb41b79588816576a5d7a06fa92aa
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly translate all branches/tags/shas:

The code which raises an error if two elements try
to install different versions of the same git repo
currently works correctly for SHAs, or if a branch
is specified first, followed by a SHA.

However it fails if two branches are specified, because
the shallow clone does not fetch all branch heads.

This change correctly handles any combination of
SHAs/branch-heads/tags.

Change-Id: I501e94150ddeb41b79588816576a5d7a06fa92aa

commit_message:
fix sever not deleted issue in test_attach_detach_volume.

The server will not be deleted in test_attach_detach_volume, if
exception raise in _create_and_attach. The patch fix this issue.

bug 1153493

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-08 10:11:19.000000000', 'message': "Trying to umount everytime during inject file into image

If the error occurs in 'mount' operation, but the image is mounted, the 'umount'
operation will not be executed and results in the 'kpartx -d' operation failed
with ProcessExecutionError raised, 'qemu-nbd -d' operation will not be
executed, so the NBD device isn't released.

Fixes bug #1152519

Change-Id: Icc7d15196f3ee67674f9d815ddeef4378f363e2c
"}, {'created': '2013-03-11 02:27:25.000000000', 'message': "Fixes nbd device can't be released error while injecting file into image

When the 'mount' operation is successful but stderr is not empty, there may be
some warning messages output to stderr, so we need to discard them and continue
to inject files into image.

Fixes bug #1152519

Change-Id: Icc7d15196f3ee67674f9d815ddeef4378f363e2c
"}, {'created': '2013-03-11 03:09:36.000000000', 'message': "Fixes nbd device can't be released error

When the 'mount' operation is successful but stderr is not empty during
injecting key/file into image, there may be some warning messages output to
stderr, so we need to discard them and continue to inject files into image.

Fixes bug #1152519

Change-Id: Icc7d15196f3ee67674f9d815ddeef4378f363e2c
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes nbd device can't be released error

When the 'mount' operation is successful but stderr is not empty during
injecting key/file into image, there may be some warning messages output to
stderr, so we need to discard them and continue to inject files into image.

Fixes bug #1152519

Change-Id: Icc7d15196f3ee67674f9d815ddeef4378f363e2c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-11 21:05:05.000000000', 'message': "Force resource updates to update updated_at

When there's no changes in resources, compute_node_update (and other
DB update calls) won't modify 'updated_at'.

'updated_at' is what is used to invalidate the cache in the scheduler's
host_manager.  Because of a race with the compute manager, the scheduler
could be out of sync with the compute_nodes table but have a newer time
on its cache.

By always updating 'updated_at' on resource updates, the periodic task
will be sure to invalidate any bad cache the scheduler has.

Fixes bug 1153778

Change-Id: I19b51a5b84f472cd0f4de6460a4edb540cc62da2

commit_message:
Force resource updates to update updated_at

When there's no changes in resources, compute_node_update (and other
DB update calls) won't modify 'updated_at'.

'updated_at' is what is used to invalidate the cache in the scheduler's
host_manager.  Because of a race with the compute manager, the scheduler
could be out of sync with the compute_nodes table but have a newer time
on its cache.

By always updating 'updated_at' on resource updates, the periodic task
will be sure to invalidate any bad cache the scheduler has.

Fixes bug 1153778

Change-Id: I19b51a5b84f472cd0f4de6460a4edb540cc62da2

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

commit_message:
heat engine : Add validation of stack names

Add regex validation of stack names, aligns us with stack names
allowed by AWS, with the addition of "." and "_" characters

fixes bug 1103447

Change-Id: I8fab0d3ad03379dfc2a18dc016e66ca8fee6cc86

commit_message:
heat templates : Update for F18

Remove F16 as it's EOL, update with F18 as it's the current
version.  Leave the default as F17 for now in all except the
Openshift templates (because Openshift doesn't work on F17,
although these templates are currently broken anyway..)

fixes bug 1154121

Change-Id: Ia95e6bfb4a15e355dfb0051d57f5b70a408551c6

commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: I1a2ea0c36161df15fd55e95a6679628d14858944

i tried to minimize the code change and to avoid touching oslo. the solution is similar to how nova launches except in nova, the filename is an attribute in config file.

of note:

2.config-dir parameter reads in all *.conf files in directory, current fix expects at least one of them to be keystone.conf'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-25 18:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
put an early assert on ssh connection

make sure the ssh connection is functional before we fail on the
write_to_console.

Change-Id: I81b29dbb924fce2debf6c8841299f727b6836cba

log.setup() doesn't really initialize root logger, therefore logging
in 3rd party library such as stevedore doesn't work properly. This
patch enable root logger initialization.

Fix bug: # 1073241

Change-Id: I6fa41b2ba41ff97ad0280f8774a26887d294423e
"}]
commit_message:
Initialize root logger in _setup_logging_from_conf()

log.setup() doesn't really initialize root logger, therefore logging
in 3rd party library such as stevedore doesn't work properly. This
patch enable root logger initialization.

Fix bug: # 1073241

Change-Id: I6fa41b2ba41ff97ad0280f8774a26887d294423e

commit_message:
Remove instance['instance_type'] relationship from db api

This removes the entire relationship between an instance and the flavor
it was created from. As such, it removes two tests entirely which
examined the old behavior.

This is one change in a series aimed at removing the use of instance-linked
instance_type objects, in favor of the decoupled type data in
system_metadata. See bug 1140119 for more details.

Change-Id: I8b525a900bf2dc6b193e54aae35fc32248e4cff4

[{'created': '2013-03-07 05:41:25.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate CONF.fixed_range, do dynamic setup

Change the default value of CONF.fixed_range to None. If set to
None, do dynamic fixed_range setup by pulling the networks that
should exist on the host and making the appropriate calls to set up
the NAT entries for each network. This allows for non-contiguous
subnets to be configured in the fixed_ip space and only configures
the NAT rules as they are needed. This also restricts the NAT range
to the smallest range required preventing the NAT from impacting
subnets that might exist on the external network.

DocImpact: For backwards compatibility, Grizzly will still support
the CONF.fixed_range option and if set will perform the default logic
from Folsom and earlier releases. The intention is to remove the
CONF.fixed_range option early in the Havana cycle.

Change-Id: I4ec111079f7a1d253190e6a6008048f992a53f68
Fixes: bug #741626 #966175

commit_message:
Deprecate CONF.fixed_range, do dynamic setup

Do dynamic fixed_range setup by pulling the networks that should
exist on the host and making the appropriate calls to set up the NAT
entries for each network. This allows for non-contiguous subnets to
be configured in the fixed_ip space and only configures the NAT rules
as they are needed. This also restricts the NAT range to the smallest
range required preventing the NAT from impacting subnets that might
exist on the external network.

DocImpact: For backwards compatibility, Grizzly will still support
the CONF.fixed_range option and if set will perform the default logic
from Folsom and earlier releases. To use the new dynamic fixed_range
setup in Grizzly, set fixed_range='' in your nova.conf. The intention
is to remove the CONF.fixed_range option entirely early in the Havana
cycle and use the dynamic fixed_range setup from Havana going
forward.

Change-Id: I4ec111079f7a1d253190e6a6008048f992a53f68
Fixes: bug #741626 bug #966175

commit_message:
Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release

Fixes bug #1128256

oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
we can switch to using it directly.

Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91

commit_message:
Adds a flag to set glance api version to call

Allows a glance api verion to be set using a flag.
Cinder will generate a version of the glance client as per this
flag.

Fix bug: # 1152542

Change-Id: I80423f5d88e7ccf0614f89d3c15d983f0af9c333

commit_message:
Set debug to True in cinder.conf

Adds a line to lib/cinder to turn on debug logging
by default in Cinder.

Change-Id: I9cc7d78b97eea40fc787ca68721b58fc7a00faf4

'}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-03-11 11:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-03-11 11:17:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Zhi Yan Liu, your comment that the 'volume_usage_poll_interval' will not happen when ticked is correct, but I think it is not relevant in this case. I would prefer to use the pattern as it is for two reasons:

1. It is the pattern used in nova/compute/manager.py for the periodic task _poll_volume_usage(). I think it is better to use similar patterns for similar operations across all openstack code.
   
2. I believe the code as it is, implements what is required for usage notifications. We want the notifications to occur approximately every voume_usage_poll_interval. It is perfectly acceptable for notification to be made up to 1 'periodic_task' interval late.
   
The alternatives you suggest would not improve operation, the minimum billing period, per last_completed_audit_period(), is one hour and the periodic_task period is one minute. Sending notifications every minute, when they are only required every hour, would be an unacceptable increase in amqp and logging traffic.

Your second option, that the user would specify a count of periodic_task intervals would not be optimal, first because they currently have to specify the volume usage interval in Nova in seconds: it would be very confusing to have to use two different numbers to specify the same interval for volume iops usage (nova) and volume existance (cinder).  It would also be confusing if the actual notification period changed because someone changed the periodic timer interval without changing the volume_usage_poll_interval.


I didn't implement unit tests because there were no tests for cinder/volume/manager.py. But you are correct, we do need unit tests, I've added tests/test_volume_manager.py

Note that I made another minor change to the function _poll_volume_exists(). I changed from counting the number of volumes in the current billing period, which is what nova/grizzly, correctly, does for iops usage (nova/compute/manager.py); to counting the number of volumes in the last completed billing period, which is what nova/folsom did for volume counting."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-11 11:19:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum : SKIPPED

commit_message:
Add periodic task for volume exists audit messages

A notification message is sent every volume_usage_poll_interval
seconds for each volume that existed in the last completed audit
period.

Fixes bug 1149524

Change-Id: I44f3c4cd213440c1a4c7b110f8873d26a7a31577

commit_message:
Add docs for AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation

fixes bug 1111114

This is a new filter in Grizzly that isolates tenants to
specific aggregates - a simple section is added to the
scheduler docs.

patch2 fixes typos

commit_message:
Doc multi_instance_display_name_template option

fixes bug 1128544

multi_instance_display_name_template is a new option to grizzly,
which this patch documents

unrelated to the bug report, security_group_api was missing, so
this was added too

patch2 clarifies wording

commit_message:
Ability to dynamically construct the version

* Delay the injection of the version just before we parse
  the cli
* Check if the version is a lambda function or a string and
  deal with it appropriately
* Added a test case

Fix for LP# 1138844

Change-Id: I3fd5779f0007871f98a8a2aa9a0cf28dee750d40

[{'created': '2013-03-07 16:20:32.000000000', 'message': 'Specify instance uuid to NONE and add a missing space

* if instance or instance_uuid is not present, we should
  default the string printed to NONE
* Need a space between the instance and message

so we can grep the logs to figure out where we are not
logging instance uuids and for tools that parse logs
to better distinguish the uuid and the message

commit_message:
Specify instance uuid to Unknown

* if instance or instance_uuid is not present, we should
  default the string printed to Unknown

Change-Id: Ic602e8c558b0ffd6317a07a9bf0e4828c5a5c549

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-25 20:32:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

eek -- ayoung and i had a discussion about this and i think we have a better solution"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-25 20:46:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So, to get enabled & disable users in a domain, it's completely valid for a query string to not have a value:

  GET /users?enabled&domain_id=abc

  GET /users?disabled&domain_id=abc

It's mere presence it's sufficient as a filter.

This obviously represents a 400 Bad Request:

  GET /users?enabled&disabled

I think that's more http-friendly and language agnostic than expecting a limited set of arbitrary values, encouraging two different clients to issue two different queries expecting the same response... which isn't cache-friendly either."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-02-26 00:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So understand perhaps us not wanting to support a variety of ways on saying 'false' (i.e. false, no, 0 etc.)....and I also understand that you can have an attribute without a value.  However, using an attribute that is not part of the entity seems very odd to me (e.g. "disabled").  What if the attribute was, for example, "restrict_access" (to pick a random example).  We would then test, explicitly for "open_access"?  How would we agree on such names?  How would we have a valid test for filtering against the DB?

As a counter proposal, how about we support, for booleans:

attrib_name (no value) -> filter for attrib_name is true
attrib_name:1 -> filter for attrib_name is true
attrib_name:0 -> filter for attrib_name is false

and no other permutations?'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-02-26 00:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For clarity, repeating options in last comment, due to formatting:

attrib_name (no value) -> filter for attrib_name is true

attrib_name:1 -> filter for attrib_name is true

attrib_name:0 -> filter for attrib_name is false'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:32:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-02-26 11:34:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Dolph/Adam - see my comments in reply to yours on patch3 - I have implemented my counter proposal since I think (hope!) that this satisfies the concerns and doesn't have some of the issues with using non-entity names in the query string."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-26 12:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Improve tests for api protection and filtering

Fills out some more tests for both these areas.  To make it easier for
any v3 tests to do their own authentication, moved the auth builder
utility functions from test_v3_auth into test_v3.RestfulTestCase.

Also fixed an issue that meant the api filtering on a boolean
would not work.

Fixes Bug #1132080
Fixes Bug #1132372

Change-Id: I7bb7b5ba61adfc6a9c496a5547a0ca3fcfbab209

commit_message:
Return XML message with objectserver 404.

Resolves bug 1076534 by adding a XML formatted message to HTTP
requests which result in a status of 404.

Change-Id: I4afbdc0f6bd5f3a78729351cee570c50952a6843

Unignore log_format option

Allow log_format option to be settable by the operator,
as per configure-logging documentation. Thanks to Marcus Furlong.

Fixes LP: #1124716

Change-Id: I15d39b3162643c22ff6c905ecbb2efa06e2d882f

'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-11 00:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-11 07:20:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

It seems like eventlet is doing a greenlet context switch because we're sending out a syslog message and eventlet clears any exception when doing a context switch. It's not clear to me why eventlet doesn't restore the exception when it switches back. This (https://github.com/SiteSupport/gevent/issues/246) suggests the issue is fixed in newer greenlet? Am I understanding the issue correctly?

There's another example of the bug in LoopingCall.start()

  except Exception:
      LOG.exception(_('in looping call'))
      done.send_exception(*sys.exc_info())
      return

I think we need to add a helper here so we can help people avoid re-introducing this bug in other places. We cannot assume everybody will understand that LOG.exception() sometimes (depending on configuration) will clear exc_info

How about:

  with excutils.save_and_restore_exception():
      LOG.exception(...)
  ctxt.reply(...)

which would be equivalent to:

  except Exception:
      try:
          with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception():
              LOG.exception(...)
      except Exception:
          ctxt.reply(...)

however, I'm not sure there's a way of restoring sys.exc_info() that will work with python 3 - AFAIK, in python3 exc_info is only valid during an exception handler"}, {'account_id': 6348, 'date': '2013-03-11 09:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-12 15:15:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I've filed https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1154140 to track adding a helper for this"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-12 15:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.

[{'created': '2013-03-08 06:50:34.000000000', 'message': 'Keep exc_info() to prevent an internal error

Fixes bug 1135539
When SysLogHandler is configured in UDP socket mode, the user
who doesn't have the admin privilege got the unexpecting internal
server error(HTTP 500) in "nova dns-create-private-domain" command.
This bug occurs as the call graph drew below:

|--ProxyCallback._process_data():amqp.py
                          |--LOG.exception()
                          |    :
                          |    |--BaseHub.switch():hub.py
                          |                 |-- clear_sys_exc_info()
                          |
                          |--ctxt.reply(None, sys.exc_info(),..)
                                       |
                                       :
                                       |
                         |--serialize_remote_exception():common.py
                                       |--failure_info#(None,None,None)

The sys.exc_info() is cleared by the clear_sys_exc_info(), but it is
called again by the ctxt.reply().
This patch prevents the internal error and returns the details of
the forbidden error(HTTP 403) which is expected.

Change-Id: I549b4b2365c53c401edc80bbe30bcde249d27b85
'}, {'created': '2013-03-11 00:30:56.000000000', 'message': 'Keep exc_info() to prevent an internal error

who doesn't have the admin privilege got the unexpecting internal

This bug occurs as the call graph drew below:

|--ProxyCallback._process_data():amqp.py
                          |--LOG.exception()
                          |    :
                          |    |--BaseHub.switch():hub.py
                          |                 |-- clear_sys_exc_info()
                          |
                          |--ctxt.reply(None, sys.exc_info(),..)
                                       |
                                       :
                                       |
                         |--serialize_remote_exception():common.py
                                       |--failure_info#(None,None,None)

The sys.exc_info() is cleared by the clear_sys_exc_info(), but it is
called again by the ctxt.reply().
This patch prevents the internal error and returns the details of
the forbidden error(HTTP 403) which is expected.

Change-Id: I549b4b2365c53c401edc80bbe30bcde249d27b85
'}]
commit_message:
Keep exc_info() to prevent an internal error

Fixes bug 1135539
When SysLogHandler is configured in UDP socket mode, the user
who doesn't have the admin privilege got the unexpecting internal
server error(HTTP 500) in "nova dns-create-private-domain" command.
This bug occurs as the call graph drew below:

|--ProxyCallback._process_data():amqp.py
                          |--LOG.exception()
                          |    :
                          |    |--BaseHub.switch():hub.py
                          |                 |-- clear_sys_exc_info()
                          |
                          |--ctxt.reply(None, sys.exc_info(),..)
                                       |
                                       :
                                       |
                         |--serialize_remote_exception():common.py
                                       |--failure_info#(None,None,None)

The sys.exc_info() is cleared by the clear_sys_exc_info(), but it is
called again by the ctxt.reply().
This patch prevents the internal error and returns the details of
the forbidden error(HTTP 403) which is expected.

Change-Id: I549b4b2365c53c401edc80bbe30bcde249d27b85

commit_message:
Require the log_dir to exist.

This patch resolves bug 1065430, by requiring that the log directory
exist when logging is setup. Note that if you set an explicit log file,
then this check is skipped.

Change-Id: Ia190d3105db3d30a4662a51806f173e4825ed76e

commit_message:
Update oslo rpc libraries

Update oslo rpc libraries to capture changes, primarly motivated
by secret=True flag on password config options.

Added bin/quantum-rpc-zmq-receiver

The Windows Storage Cinder plugin through
the Windows Locks implementation
of the InterProcessLock fails in
attaching/detaching operations.

Change-Id: I682205592e152b3222e04ca3221d25594d134dd9
Fixes: bug #1153966
'}]
commit_message:
Fix locking issues in Windows

The Windows Storage Cinder plugin through
the Windows Locks implementation
of the InterProcessLock fails in
attaching/detaching operations.

Change-Id: I682205592e152b3222e04ca3221d25594d134dd9
Fixes: bug #1153966

commit_message:
Handle vcpu counting failures gracefully

The virDomainGetVcpus() call in libvirt can fail in some cases. This
should be handled properly in nova and not cause failures in starting
up new instances.

Fixes bug 1153694

Change-Id: I8e072c53ee2bafcb50083d793ceabe5292038ab6

commit_message:
Fixed the blocking unittest issues.

1. Fixed the bug #1153921 introduced by the nova changeset
https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/bd5a9b87.

2. Adapted to the latest keystoneclient middleware change introduced by
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/d782a998.

We must explicit set auth_version to prevent the middleware to
automatically detect its api version from remote keystone server in
unittest.

Change-Id: I439a74a7f9a8a62369ae50dc1d5e50e20f4d3574

Fixes volume attach on Hyper-V with IPv6

addresses during login on the storage target.

    -H "Content-type: application/json" \
    -H "X_Auth_Token: <authtokenid>" \
    -d '{"user": {"password": "ABCD", "original_password": "DCBA"}}'

'}]
commit_message:
Change update_own_password's argument 'management' from False to True.

It should use management_url rather than auth_url.

Bug 1082539

The Equivalent of doing
curl -X PATCH http://localhost:5000/v2.0/OS-KSCRUD/users/<userid> \
    -H "Content-type: application/json" \
    -H "X_Auth_Token: <authtokenid>" \
    -d '{"user": {"password": "ABCD", "original_password": "DCBA"}}'

Change-Id: I8657c9a64060f07a1c4fb6bceba4d570bbf28530

commit_message:
Use internal DB management

Use our own internal code for managing database migrations, rather than
calling sqlalchemy-migrate's command line directly. This allows us to
automatically specify the initial version of the database, which is
required in order to be able to squash migrations (bug 1072949).

Change-Id: I88206f8b55fe6fe4016cee8e5bf1d5eeb0ae30d2

commit_message:
Quantum deployment use cases test suites

Implements Tempest tests suites for the Quantum deployment use cases defined in
Chapter 1 and Appendix A of the Quantum Administration Guide.

This commit implements the following use cases:

Single Flat Network
Multiple Flat Networks
Mixed Flat and Private Networks

For more information on the Quantum deployment use cases, see:

http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-network/admin/content/use_cases.html
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-network/admin/content/app_demo.html

Blueprint: Quantum API v2.0 Tempest tests
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/quantum-basic-api

Change-Id: Iff2aeb29c95084c6c08ecc8e9e87294092ca34e1

messages:

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-13 10:37:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-02-13 17:05:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

This seems odd to me because access_allowed() is assuming that the AccessKey, User and Policy and all in the same stack, but we are now possibly passing different stacks. (However, I think I now understand the need for the load balancer instance resource name to change in the following patch.)

I'm not convinced that this fixes the right thing (see inline comment)."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-02-13 23:43:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I am inclined to suggest we make nested stacks completely
visible, and just don't allow independent update/delete.

(in an attempt to reduce the special casing)

Any thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-02-16 08:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Re "I am inclined to suggest we make nested stacks completely visible"

It seems like we do want user-defined AWS::CloudFormation::Stack resources to be visible via the API - the CFN docs say that Ref returns an ARN to the embedded stack (which can then presumably be used to query the CFN API for info on that stack)

However for the heat internally defined stacks, I'm not so sure - maybe we just treat them the same and expose them too, but it could be confusing for users "where did that stack come from?!" since it's an internal implementation detail of particular resources and not part of their template.

I'm not sure if the additional complexity of treating them differently is justified though.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-02-18 08:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

How about:

1) AWS::CloudFormation::Stack resources show up as completely normal stacks (we use a unique name + set owner=None).

2) Other nested stacks don't show up in ListStacks &c. (i.e. we continue passing the parent stack as the "owner"), but can still be accessed normally by anyone who knows the ARN (which can be found from the PhysicalResourceId, and of course appears in e.g. WaitConditionHandle URLs of resources inside the nested stack).

I think I would be inclined to approve a patch that implemented this. I have code to help generating the unique names that I can commit if anybody wants it.'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-02-18 16:42:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Zane's last comment is the proper way to proceed."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-02-25 10:50:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

-2ing this, since I'm working on a patch which supersedes this approach to fix bug 1131666

It turns out you can already read nested stack resource metadata provided you use the full ARN, so we just need to get the ARN into the instance then this approach looking up the stack name becomes unnecessary"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-12 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-12 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-13 10:24:23.000000000', 'message': "Support nested stacks when authorizing a user

When an instance in a nested stack needed to access its metadata, the
request would fail because the check was being made against the parent
stack, not the nested one.

This is correct in that we should not expose nested stacks via the API
(they're an implementation detail) but we still need to provide the
access to the instances' metadata.

This expands the authorization checks to any stacks nested within the
current one.

Change-Id: Ifa53c19431f0e438c6ac9a4d65e424baa6ad6678
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>
"}]
commit_message:
Support nested stacks when authorizing a user

When an instance in a nested stack needed to access its metadata, the
request would fail because the check was being made against the parent
stack, not the nested one.

This is correct in that we should not expose nested stacks via the API
(they're an implementation detail) but we still need to provide the
access to the instances' metadata.

This expands the authorization checks to any stacks nested within the
current one.

Change-Id: Ifa53c19431f0e438c6ac9a4d65e424baa6ad6678
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Download rate limiting

This commit adds the ability to limit the rate of download of every
transfer.  There is a new global configuration setting called
download_rate_limit which sets the limit in bytes per second of
every transfer for that glance service.  In the future, when glance
is integrated with a per user quota system a change to make this
limit on a per user/transfer level should be trivial.

The token bucket algorithm is used to implement the rate limit.

blueprint transfer-rate-limiting

Change-Id: I53d2db65c76369083bf95f3dd65346ea0d1d212a

commit_message:
Storwize/SVC driver fix for multibackend scenario.

In order for the Filter scheduler to be used to it's full advantage
Cinder drivers need to move away from using FLAGS directly and switch
to appending their specific options to self.configuration.

Fixes bug: 1135391

Change-Id: I8d07346c03d1cf2479738f7161ee0a0cb9f518a0

[{'created': '2013-03-04 05:20:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auth-token middleware to understand v3 tokens

Now that the Identity server supports v3 tokens, the auth_token
middleware should permit the in-line validation of such a token.  This
essentially means just setting any new environment items
that correspond to the new attributes that may be in a v3 token (such
as domains), as well as allowing for the slight format differences.

Most of the work in this change is actually in the unit tests, where
it was important to try and enable the existing tests to be run against
an auth_token middleware configured for both v2 and v3.  This meant
restructing the test class so that the token format is separated
from the individual tests and is initialized by the class Setup().

Since there are some new signed token formats included in this testing,
a new set of the signed tokens was generated.

Fixes Bug #1132390

Change-Id: I78b232d30f5310c39089fbbc8e56c23df291f89f

commit_message:
Fix auth-token middleware to understand v3 tokens

Now that the Identity server supports v3 tokens, the auth_token
middleware should permit the in-line validation of such a token.  This
essentially means just setting any new environment items
that correspond to the new attributes that may be in a v3 token (such
as domains), as well as allowing for the slight format differences.

Most of the work in this change is actually in the unit tests, where
it was important to try and enable the existing tests to be run against
an auth_token middleware configured for both v2 and v3.  This meant
restructing the test class so that the token format is separated
from the individual tests and is initialized by the class Setup().

Since there are some new signed token formats included in this testing,
a new set of the signed tokens was generated.

Fixes Bug #1132390

Change-Id: I78b232d30f5310c39089fbbc8e56c23df291f89f

_get_iscsi_properties checks for iscsi_helper == 'tgtadm', but
this is run for drivers other than ISCSIDriver.  This means that
when using the Nexenta driver, the target_lun is changed when it
shouldn't be.

Only change target_lun based on iscsi_helper if using ISCSIDriver.

Change-Id: I104c1b45f37917ea9f41855c17405f63c4ebcc39
"}]
commit_message:
Only use iscsi_helper config option if using ISCSIDriver

_get_iscsi_properties checks for iscsi_helper == 'tgtadm', but
this is run for drivers other than ISCSIDriver.  This means that
when using the Nexenta driver, the target_lun is changed when it
shouldn't be.

Only change target_lun based on iscsi_helper if using ISCSIDriver.

Change-Id: I104c1b45f37917ea9f41855c17405f63c4ebcc39

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-01 15:27:05.000000000', 'message': 'Accepts UUID as an ID of Floating IP

Fixes bug 1052561.

In Quanutm, Floating IPs are identified by UUID instead of integer ID.
After quantum-nova integration for FLoating IP has been implemented,
Horizon also needs to accept UUID style of ID for Floating IP.

Change-Id: I6ed919cbbc818c97cecef2fe3a91c8e5a7ac76e0
(cherry picked from commit 7ab5ace768797f56bf7e1c846fca0f1d40ed6086)
'}]
commit_message:
Accepts UUID as an ID of Floating IP

Fixes bug 1052561.

In Quanutm, Floating IPs are identified by UUID instead of integer ID.
After quantum-nova integration for FLoating IP has been implemented,
Horizon also needs to accept UUID style of ID for Floating IP.

Change-Id: I6ed919cbbc818c97cecef2fe3a91c8e5a7ac76e0
(cherry picked from commit 7ab5ace768797f56bf7e1c846fca0f1d40ed6086)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-08 22:09:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes uncaught exception on Add Monitor when unable to retrieve pools

Variable instantiated in a try block referenced outside even when
exception happens in the api call that instantiates the variable.

Fixes: bug #1152770

Change-Id: Ic13db9ed87b2600357b0568ff6d01ef0fe28451c
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes uncaught exception on Add Monitor when unable to retrieve pools

Variable instantiated in a try block referenced outside even when
exception happens in the api call that instantiates the variable.

Fixes: bug #1152770

Change-Id: Ic13db9ed87b2600357b0568ff6d01ef0fe28451c

commit_message:
Register DB options independently of engine

We need a script that will just manage database migrations (for bug
1072949), so for this purpose we want to register only the DB options, not
all of the engine options.

Change-Id: I99bb8d5800741d71572a14c3a5a33dcf0e1b0268

commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError for NFS snapshot operations

Since NfsDriver inherits snapshot related methods from VolumeDriver,
it will try to run LVM commands for snapshot calls, when it should
just report that these are not supported for NFS.

Fixes LP: #1097266

Change-Id: Ia438c88d3c8c0a43b512bba9b273e1305f6d0dd0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-19 18:54:47.000000000', 'message': "Improve error message when the default role doesn't exist

To add members to a project, Horizon requires a default role to exist
in Keystone.  This provides a clearer error message when the role
cannot be found.

Fixes bug #1108063

Change-Id: I0e3cd4cb96c7896c675055671e0875840b1a41d3
"}]
commit_message:
Improve error message when the default role doesn't exist

To add members to a project, Horizon requires a default role to exist
in Keystone.  This provides a clearer error message when the role
cannot be found.

Fixes bug #1108063

Change-Id: I0e3cd4cb96c7896c675055671e0875840b1a41d3

[{'created': '2013-03-11 17:16:19.000000000', 'message': "Pass migration_ref when when auto-confirming

The _poll_unconfirmed_resizes() task in compute/manager calls back to
compute_api to confirm resizes. This triggers a db lookup for the
migration, which is not allowed by no-db-compute. Since we already have
the migration, pass it through to avoid the lookup.

Since this doesn't change rpcapi (and thus, RPC clients should not
know about this optional paramter), we don't need to bump the RPC
version here.

Fixes bug 1152792

Change-Id: I4bd3b0c88968ed7f64e7df0afa12e83009ee8ccf
"}]
commit_message:
Pass migration_ref when when auto-confirming

The _poll_unconfirmed_resizes() task in compute/manager calls back to
compute_api to confirm resizes. This triggers a db lookup for the
migration, which is not allowed by no-db-compute. Since we already have
the migration, pass it through to avoid the lookup.

Since this doesn't change rpcapi (and thus, RPC clients should not
know about this optional paramter), we don't need to bump the RPC
version here.

Fixes bug 1152792

Change-Id: I4bd3b0c88968ed7f64e7df0afa12e83009ee8ccf

Fixes LP: #1060868
