commit_message:
update error log arguements in filter scheduler

There's one log issue in filter scheduler fell off radar in previous
fix, this change closes the gap.

Fixes: bug #1130867

Change-Id: I78def31bd9ff4349cd1332cb96ef6311ce9eac20

I think this is generally good, although I do wonder about the change(s) in logic. I agree it's too hard to determine when/why something failed, so making that better is definite goodness.

If I am missing a sample and I run this twice, will the first run generate the samples with the raw response in the template and then pass the second time if I don't change it?

Not sure if I think that's a huge problem or not, but I worry that some reviewers wouldn't even notice.. :)"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-03-10 14:50:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 4598, 'date': '2013-03-10 15:52:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

Hi Dan,
Regarding your question about the new logic, the answer is true that if you run the module the first time w/o samples or templates it will create those files w/ the content from the raw response. This, in my opinion, will greatly help developers creating new samples/templates as they a) don't have to make the manual copy of the template into the sample. b) don't need to run the module twice for it to converge. Now, we can update the instructions to simply say:
1) Run the module to create responses/templates
2) Update the sample file(s), if necessary.
The current logic is:
1) Run the module to create samples/templates. The first time it will fail
2) Then manually copy the template file into its sample location
3) Run the module a second time"}, {'account_id': 4598, 'date': '2013-03-10 17:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-10 17:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

[{'created': '2013-03-09 14:59:52.000000000', 'message': "Add numerous fixes to test_api_samples

- Throw IOError when a template for POST/PUT operations
  does not exist instead of returning an API response error
- Create template and sample on first run when those
  don't exist. It takes two runs of this module now
  to get those files first created.

  a sample or response when comparing response results

- Create response template files which content is the same as
  its response body instead of currently 0-length body.
Fixes bug 1140384

commit_message:
Add numerous fixes to test_api_samples

- Throw IOError when a template for POST/PUT operations
  does not exist instead of returning an API response error
- Create template and sample on first run when those
  don't exist. It takes two runs of this module now
  to get those files first populated.
- Fix error labels to now specify whether we are referring to
  a sample or response when comparing response results
- Call _pretty_data() only once on sample_data before this
  param is passed to _compare_results(). This change cut the
  total execution time by .5 seconds or 1%. :)
- Create response template files which content is the same as
  its response body instead of currently 0-length body.
Fixes bug 1140384

Change-Id: Ic62ae343409b2084e6a238025a86f0b7909a1b76

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 04:11:35.000000000', 'message': "Don't change dashboard on admin tenant switch

Switching projects as an admin user currently dumps you back to
the Admin dashboard tab. This change fixes that by adding a 'next'
parameter to the switching URL that points to the default panel
of the current dashboard.

The redirect is to the default panel rather than the current one,
since the next tenant may not have access to the current panel
and we want to avoid kicking a user back to the login screen.

Fixes bug #1072848.

Change-Id: I25b8c0e38945d5db57f5bfe7bb174cdbd66156d5
"}]
commit_message:
Don't change dashboard on admin tenant switch

Switching projects as an admin user currently dumps you back to
the Admin dashboard tab. This change fixes that by adding a 'next'
parameter to the switching URL that points to the default panel
of the current dashboard.

The redirect is to the default panel rather than the current one,
since the next tenant may not have access to the current panel
and we want to avoid kicking a user back to the login screen.

Fixes bug #1072848.

Change-Id: I25b8c0e38945d5db57f5bfe7bb174cdbd66156d5

commit_message:
Turn down requests logging level

Looks like the default is INFO, we don't need to see that unless
--debug is specified.

Change-Id: Ieee5d4dc5102f11536ecc6330461f86101811f9e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 21:05:50.000000000', 'message': "Update tox.ini to support RHEL 6.x.

In order to support running unit tests on RHEL 6.x we need to patch
eventlet with contrib/redhat-eventlet.patch. We already
have support for this in the tools/install_venv.py but we need
to make a couple changes to allow tox to consume this.

1) Updates install_venv.py to support an option to run the
   post-process hook only (this is what applies patches).

2) Updates our patch command in install_venv_common.py to use
   -N (Ignore already applied patches). We do this so the
   command can run multiple times and not fail.

3) Update tox.ini to call 'python tools/install_venv.py -p'
   so that it applies the eventlet patches on distros that
   require it.

Change-Id: I3e2b07c3f718e4aede5c5f231ff0cdb7721ec885
"}, {'created': '2013-03-07 01:58:19.000000000', 'message': "Update tox.ini to support RHEL 6.x.

eventlet with contrib/redhat-eventlet.patch. We already
have support for this in the tools/install_venv.py but we need
to make a couple changes to allow tox to consume this.

This patch updates install_venv.py to support an environment
variable called 'TOX_PATCH_VENV' which is used to
make install_venv.py run post-process hooks only (this is what applies patches).

Also updates tox.ini so that we set TOX_PATCH_VENV when both testing
and coverage tasks are executed.

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to support RHEL 6.x.

In order to support running unit tests on RHEL 6.x we need to patch
eventlet with contrib/redhat-eventlet.patch. We already
have support for this in the tools/install_venv_common.py but we need
to make a couple changes to allow tox to consume this:

1) Sync in the latest intall_venv_common.py from oslo. This changes
 patch to use the -N option (ignore already applied patches) and makes
 it safe to call the patching function more than once.

2) Add a new patch_tox_venv.py script in tools.

3) Update tox.ini to call patch_tox_venv.py before it runs tests and
coverage.

Change-Id: I3e2b07c3f718e4aede5c5f231ff0cdb7721ec885

5dd1553cca7f7e62eebce75e1d936fc211b239ec moved to using a FQDN for

the change will break the host column on the instances table. I can't

has moved after this change.

Revert to using just the hostname (no domain), and we'll revisit the
intent of 5dd1553cca7f7e62eebce75e1d936fc211b239ec separately.

Resolves bug 1151012.

Change-Id: I944f46d6eb2a6944a12833ec8de7afa2b18e66e7
"}]
commit_message:
Revert changing to FQDN for hostnames.

5dd1553cca7f7e62eebce75e1d936fc211b239ec moved to using a FQDN for
host names. This caused bug 1151012, but Russell and I also believe
the change will break the host column on the instances table. I can't
do a plain old git revert for this change because a lot of the code
has moved after this change.

Revert to using just the hostname (no domain), and we'll revisit the
intent of 5dd1553cca7f7e62eebce75e1d936fc211b239ec separately.

Resolves bug 1151012.

Change-Id: I944f46d6eb2a6944a12833ec8de7afa2b18e66e7

'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-02-20 07:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I think this kind of logic should be handled by the command itself. Adding this to the main shell module makes it less abstract and somehow API dependent. 

Would it make sense to decorate API commands for catching some signals and register the specific clean-up functions there?

Or even better (but this change would be bigger and would need a bp as well) change how commands are working and implement them as "loadable" classes? I did something like this for a personal project. Check here for examples:

https://github.com/FlaPer87/bugsquasher/blob/master/bugsquasher/commands/base.py

https://github.com/FlaPer87/bugsquasher/blob/master/bugsquasher/commands/update.py

With that it could be possible to define clean_up methods for each command + any other logic needed. It might be "too over-thought" for glanceclient, though.'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-02-20 18:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-20 19:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Control C does not cancel the CLI cleanly

When a user attempts to terminate the CLI with CTL+C a stack
trace is printed to the screen.  When downloading files the
partial amount downloaded will not be cleaned up.  In most
cases the user redirects to stdout, thus this program cannot
clean that up.

Fixes Bug: 1130390

Change-Id: If9f8ffc72b422d5dbd5969eecde8904238dd8860

commit_message:
Check if flavor id is an empty string

Now once a flavor is created with empty string id, its id and
name cannot be specified when we use or delete the flavor.

This checks if flavorid is empty when creating a new flavor.
And if so, assigns auto-generated flavorid.

Fixes bug: 1148563

Change-Id: Ib48c4cc4ebd993d1f3f3d60a7bb856eff3c279d5

[{'created': '2013-03-07 17:22:19.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use prefix to lookup host in Storwize/SVC.

Currently, the Storwize/SVC driver creates a host name prefix for host
objects on the back-end, and uses that to look up hosts. However, if a
host was already created with a different name (for example, manually
by an admin), the host creation operation will fail, as a host with
that connection information already exists. Instead, we look up a host
based on available connection information.

Fixes bug: 1149072

Change-Id: I336dbea85bfaf928a550a15d177e2b9b0ffd38bf
'}, {'created': '2013-03-11 09:10:12.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use prefix to lookup host in Storwize/SVC.

Currently, the Storwize/SVC driver creates a host name prefix for host
objects on the back-end, and uses that to look up hosts. However, if a
host was already created with a different name (for example, manually
by an admin), the host creation operation will fail, as a host with
that connection information already exists. Instead, we look up a host
based on available connection information.

Fixes bug: 1149072

Change-Id: I336dbea85bfaf928a550a15d177e2b9b0ffd38bf
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use prefix to lookup host in Storwize/SVC.

Currently, the Storwize/SVC driver creates a host name prefix for host
objects on the back-end, and uses that to look up hosts. However, if a
host was already created with a different name (for example, manually
by an admin), the host creation operation will fail, as a host with
that connection information already exists. Instead, we look up a host
based on available connection information.

Fixes bug: 1149072

Change-Id: I336dbea85bfaf928a550a15d177e2b9b0ffd38bf

commit_message:
clear up method parameters for _modify_rules

'table_name' is always used anyway, so there's no reason to have it as
optional especially as it's not perfectly clear that it's only needed
when current_lines is empty

'binary' was never used

Change-Id: I2c6bcf3fcff1c097d1f5c5ae34aa3428a94dabdc

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 10:28:03.000000000', 'message': 'Stops conductor generating useless logs on startup

Passes a special argument to call to stop it logging. This argument is
picked up by the openstack.common.rpc.common.exceptions_logged decorator
telling to not log any exceptions for the ping calls while the conductor
wakes up.

Depends on oslo-incubator patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23508/
Fixes bug: #1148516
Related to bug: #1137994

Change-Id: I61fba0a167c0358af8091e35933fb65abe9f8fa7
'}]
commit_message:
Stops conductor generating useless logs on startup

Passes a special argument to call to stop it logging. This argument is
picked up by the openstack.common.rpc.common.exceptions_logged decorator
telling to not log any exceptions for the ping calls while the conductor
wakes up.

Depends on oslo-incubator patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23508/
Fixes bug: #1148516
Related to bug: #1137994

Change-Id: I61fba0a167c0358af8091e35933fb65abe9f8fa7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-11 16:18:12.000000000', 'message': 'XenAPI: fix post install documentation

Fixes bug 929062.

The install manual was not mentioning that the /images directory needs
to be a symlink, pointing to the local SR. With this change, the
duplicated documentation was removed, and a link was placed to point to
the configuration manual.

Change-Id: Ic08f56ce77a94ea0c408d888b2c155e31da20603
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: fix post install documentation

Fixes bug 929062.

The install manual was not mentioning that the /images directory needs
to be a symlink, pointing to the local SR. With this change, the
duplicated documentation was removed, and a link was placed to point to
the configuration manual.

Change-Id: Ic08f56ce77a94ea0c408d888b2c155e31da20603

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-11 16:37:26.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid manipulating DB directly in unit test

Use the parser.Stack class for inserting data into the database in the
watch rule unit tests. If there is direct database manipulation in the unit
tests, it risks falling out of step with the implementation in the code (in
this case, by not supplying the disable_rollback value).

(Required to squash DB migrations, bug 1072949)

Change-Id: I66e5a0093d20222c876f52e626043704777dcb6a
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid manipulating DB directly in unit test

Use the parser.Stack class for inserting data into the database in the
watch rule unit tests. If there is direct database manipulation in the unit
tests, it risks falling out of step with the implementation in the code (in
this case, by not supplying the disable_rollback value).

(Required to squash DB migrations, bug 1072949)

Change-Id: I66e5a0093d20222c876f52e626043704777dcb6a

Set correct type for owner_id in DB model

This was already fixed in the database migrations (see bug 1078854), but
was still wrong in the model.

Change-Id: I8c0302d295ac228b6911a6c55e841066a502bdb1

I wonder why quantumclient should still be considered optional? There is a recent pypi release now.

I don't think it is unreasonable to make quantumclient a requirement even on deployments which don't use quantum, since it will be as well packaged as any other openstack client lib."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-03-08 08:23:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

1) Anything that can be optional should be optional. It's up to deployers to decide which resources to make available.

2) The version of python-quantumclient we require is not packaged, at least in the Fedora 17 Folsom repo.

Not everybody runs devstack; I personally cannot continue using my current workflow without this fix."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-03-08 19:51:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Skip quantum unit tests if client not installed

Quantum is optional, so we should skip unit tests that require
quantumclient if it is not available.

Fixes bug 1152242

Change-Id: I6c399b1845adfe457051c372601db6352cdf6261

heat clients : Fix --timeout option for heat-boto

Fix boto client wrapper so it passes the timeout value to boto

fixes bug 1135970

@dims -- Pavel added stack trace to the bug description. The problem was that the 'evacuate' action event has not been registered in the DB, and hence the exception was raised in event_action_start.
@russel -- as far as I understand, both event_action_start and event_action_finish are invoked from the decorator, based on DB registration in record_action_start. So, no explicit "finsih" call is needed.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-11 01:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fixes instance action exception in "evacuate" API.

'Evacuate' instance action was not created (incl. in the DB) which
caused exception to be raised during action_event_start.

Change-Id: Iec5f0a91f9b08fbdcf3ace1eaa0efbc4d9d8fc04
Fixes: bug 1152512

commit_message:
Show Tenant_ID for secgroup-list with all-tenant

For the secgroup-list command, append the Tenant_ID
column if the --all-tenants flag is used.

Fixes bug #1118477

Change-Id: If2ff108cb0aec1327ceecc47a8c5ed9a08678e51

When using the extended server status (EXT-SRV-STS) extension, it might

The db query used is incorrect and in fact not needed anymore, since the info

Change-Id: I641c4f59a088754fe68378ae4bf217c59056b1d1

commit_message:
Extended server attributes can show wrong hypervisor_hostname

When using the extended server status (EXT-SRV-STS) extension, it might
produce the wrong hypervisor_hostname on multi-node drivers like baremetal.

The db query used is incorrect and in fact not needed anymore, since the info
is already available in the instance dict itself.

This patch resolves the issue by instead using instance['node'] directly
and further removes the no longer used compute_node_get_by_host query.

Resolves bug 1135506.

Change-Id: I641c4f59a088754fe68378ae4bf217c59056b1d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-04 18:24:20.000000000', 'message': 'Allow mongod service to launch on Fedora

Fixes bug 1144907

Previously the mongod service failed to launch, as the eager
filesystem freespace check tripped over an SELinux AVC and
also possibly a lack of freespace (depending on the size of
the hosting instance).

We work around these issue by ensuring SELinux is in
permissive mode on Fedora and also setting the --smallfiles
option.

Change-Id: I74f21662aedf9cc07b9a335d22b833a8a80dfce2
'}, {'created': '2013-03-07 13:06:51.000000000', 'message': 'Allow mongod service to launch on Fedora

Fixes bug 1144907

Previously, the mongod service may fail to launch, if the eager
filesystem freespace check trips over an SELinux AVC or finds
a lack of freespace (depending on the up-to-datedness of the
selinux-policy-targeted package and the disk size/usage in the
hosting instance).

We work around these issues by ensuring the selinux-policy-targeted
package is up-to-date when ceilometer is enabled on Fedora, and
also setting the --smallfiles option.

Change-Id: I74f21662aedf9cc07b9a335d22b833a8a80dfce2

commit_message:
Allow mongod service to launch on Fedora

Fixes bug 1144907

Previously, the mongod service may fail to launch, if the eager
filesystem freespace check trips over an SELinux AVC or finds
a lack of freespace (depending on the up-to-datedness of the
selinux-policy-targeted package and the disk size/usage in the
hosting instance).

We work around these issues by ensuring the selinux-policy-targeted
package is up-to-date when ceilometer is enabled on Fedora, and
also setting the --smallfiles option.

Change-Id: I74f21662aedf9cc07b9a335d22b833a8a80dfce2

commit_message:
Libvirt driver create images even without meta

This patch allows the libvirt driver to call _create_image and
create instance directory and other needed images even when there is no
image metadata specified.

As an added bonus, this patch refactors the code of _create_image
method a bit to make it more clear to the reader when some of the images
will and will not be created, especially with regard to booting from
volume.

Fixes bug: 1124441
Fixes bug: 1131913
Fixes bug: 1123274

blueprint: improve-boot-from-volume

Change-Id: I5a028dc0585876d35be4fb86df3a423d89e054ee

commit_message:
Add ability to control max utilization of a cell

Add a 'reserve_percent' config flag to cells to control the
maximum free capacity that a child cell will be advertised to its
parent(s).

This gives the ability to leave some reserve capacity
in child cells for operational maintenance.

Change-Id: I1dae1eae4f61ca8079c6f24e60176c31fd8a759d

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-05 21:49:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

The error message 'You are not allowed to delete the image' will lead to confusion.  If someone tries to delete an image and mistakenly tries deleting it again this message doesn't explain what is happening.  Not sure what it should be though"}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-05 22:50:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Joe Gordon - Part of the problem is I don't have a lot of info at the point where I'm catching the exception. I could potentially parse the exception thrown by the glance client and look for the string like "403 Forbidden\nForbidden to delete a deleted image.\n' (glance error response is plain text), then I'd be able to raise a different exception in the case where deleting a deleted image. This seems unnecessarily complex and error-prone, since glance could change their error response format.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-06 01:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Brant, I agree hopefully we can get some of the glance devs to common on this first though'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-07 01:14:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Brant,

I feel glance should return a http error code 410 which we should just propagate back to the user no?

-- dims

410 Gone
    Indicates that the resource requested is no longer available and will not be available again.[2] This should be used when a resource has been intentionally removed and the resource should be purged. Upon receiving a 410 status code, the client should not request the resource again in the future. Clients such as search engines should remove the resource from their indices. Most use cases do not require clients and search engines to purge the resource, and a "404 Not Found" may be used instead.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:17:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

dims -

I've been looking for a place to use 410 Gone, but I don't think it's appropriate here. The description for 410 Gone says "the resource is no longer available", but in this case the resource (/v2/<tenant>/images/<image-id>) is still available. You can GET it, so in my opinion it's not correct to respond with Gone to a DELETE. Maybe GET /v2/<tenant>/images/<image-id> on a deleted image should return 410 Gone, too?'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

makes sense to me - "GET /v2/<tenant>/images/<image-id> on a deleted image should return 410 Gone, too?" :)'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:42:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I would actually suggest you use a 404. If the image isn't going to show up in a GET /images, then it effectively does not exist. I would ignore the weird 'cannot delete a deleted image' from Glance since that only applies in the case that you are an admin (I think)."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:50:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

dims - I opened a bug, we'll see what the glance-ites say. https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1152319"}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-07 21:01:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Work In Progress

waiting on response from glance developers to bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1152319'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-07 22:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Brian W - My concern with returning 404 Not Found is that there may be other situations where delete of an image causes glance to return 403 Forbidden. Should all cases where glance returns Forbidden on delete be turned into 404 Not Found, or are there some cases where Forbidden or some other error code is more appropriate?'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-03-07 22:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

You make a good point - what would you think about exposing the 403 through?'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-07 22:49:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Brian - That's my preferred solution, and that's the intent of this patch. 

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/image/glance.py#L329 is where the glance client's HTTPForbidden gets raised as exception.ImageNotAuthorized."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-03-07 22:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Note to self - look at the patch *before* suggesting a fix :)'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-03-07 23:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Ready For Review

no plan to change glance due to bug being rejected.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-08 00:58:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

LGTM, return codes sorted out with glance team'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-08 01:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Not approving yet since the bug isn't targeted…"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-09 14:20:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Most bug fixes are fine to approve right now.  We should only stop them if they're too invasive for this close to release.  As for targeting, if they're not already targeted, Thierry has a script that will automatically target all bugs fixed when the release gets made."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-09 14:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: No score

because the image still exists and no user is allowed to delete a deleted image.

convert it to a wsgi exception for '403 Forbidden'.

Change-Id: I2f14687d5468b67389f5dd6ab338ceb54e8a29bb

commit_message:
delete deleted image 500 bug

Fixes bug 1138666

When you delete an image that you just deleted, you get a 500 Internal Server Error.
In this case, the problem isn't an internal server error but the "unauthorized" response
from the image service is not expected.

This can be recreated with devstack:
 1) delete an image
 2) delete the same image

Here's an example:

$ nova image-list
+--------------------------------------+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
| ID                                   | Name                            | Status | Server |
+--------------------------------------+---------------------------------+--------+--------+
| caa6c969-0f32-466b-8e8e-a7e0ac835470 | cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec         | ACTIVE |        |
| 8af603da-b69f-49c6-8e52-25632eccb31c | cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec-kernel  | ACTIVE |        |
| fe67d4e1-baca-4968-8638-2314373b620b | cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec-ramdisk | ACTIVE |        |
+--------------------------------------+---------------------------------+--------+--------+

$ nova image-delete caa6c969-0f32-466b-8e8e-a7e0ac835470

$ nova image-delete caa6c969-0f32-466b-8e8e-a7e0ac835470
ERROR: The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-1254f8a5-8dda-444a-a077-2072ab3baa6a)

If you delete a deleted image, the server should respond with '403 Forbidden'
because the image still exists and no user is allowed to delete a deleted image.

The fix is to catch the exception from the image service and
convert it to a wsgi exception for '403 Forbidden'.

Change-Id: I2f14687d5468b67389f5dd6ab338ceb54e8a29bb

[{'created': '2013-03-07 13:33:29.000000000', 'message': 'Server create will only process "networks" if os-networks is loaded.

When working with a quantum configuration and multiple networks you
have to be able to pass in the requested network to avoid instances
being attached to all networks, so this part of the request isn't
really optional in practice

However the os-network extension is not fully compatible with
quantum, and the operations do map very well. For example:

- Network creation has a set of options that are pretty nova-nets
  centric (such as VLAN)

- Network creation is limited to admins

- Network association and dis-association from projects is not
  the quantum model

- cidr from quantum is not shown correctly in the output of nova
  network-list and network-show

Rather than needing the os-networks extension to loaded and
thereby exposing a bunch of calls that don't really map to
quantum, it would be better to also allow processing of "networks"
when the network api is configured to be quantum

Change-Id: I0cc1faf6417d7a004dd9f0ff772860237fc94c57

commit_message:
Server create will only process "networks" if os-networks is loaded.

When working with a quantum configuration and multiple networks you
have to be able to pass in the requested network to avoid instances
being attached to all networks, so this part of the request isn't
really optional in practice

However the os-network extension is not fully compatible with
quantum, and the operations do map very well. For example:

- Network creation has a set of options that are pretty nova-nets
  centric (such as VLAN)

- Network creation is limited to admins

- Network association and dis-association from projects is not
  the quantum model

- cidr from quantum is not shown correctly in the output of nova
  network-list and network-show

Rather than needing the os-networks extension to loaded and
thereby exposing a bunch of calls that don't really map to
quantum, it would be better to also allow processing of "networks"
when the network api is configured to be quantum

Fixes bug #1150250

Change-Id: I0cc1faf6417d7a004dd9f0ff772860237fc94c57

commit_message:
Restoring the ability to run fake mode locally.

* Adding a fix which makes it easy to change logging. This is useful
  if you want to write a script to start a server, run some tests,
  and stop it.
* Fixed the configuration files which were preventing some stuff
  from working when the fake mode process started. Had to create a
  test api-paste.ini file to use the fake keystone auth.

Fixed bug #1122526
Change-Id: I85b7fa8874ec01c8d8ea0d805d12bb551ee88960

In answer to your statement, though, simply surrounding the print statements in parentheses isn't going to be a problem, and the "from __future__ import print_function" should only be necessary if you're specifying printing to an alternate stream.  Now, you would be correct about the tuple problem if there was a comma anywhere in the parentheses, but the change which added the parentheses didn't add any, and I don't believe we've used the hanging-newline feature anywhere in novaclient. commit_message:
Add wrap option to nova credentials for humans

When using Keystone PKI, a token ID can be over 3200 chars long.
Add optional --wrap option to make 'keystone token-get' human readable
By default wrap=64 (to fit in 80 char terminal).  And can be turned off by
setting wrap=0

Fix bug 1131001

Change-Id: I50be7ebb4323ab1bf07af557403f5136b49080a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-27 13:33:01.000000000', 'message': "Decodes input and encodes output

Currently novaclient doesn't handle properly incoming and outgoing
encode / decode process. As a solution for this, this patch implements a
decoding process for all data incoming from the user side and decodes
everything going out of the client, i.e: http requests, prints, etc.

This patch introduces a new module (strutils.py) taken from
oslo-incubator in order to use 2 of the functions present in it:

About safe_(decode|encode):

    Both functions try to encode / decode the incoming text using the
    stdin encoding, fallback to python's default encoding if that
    returns None or to UTF-8 as the last option.

    In both functions only basestring objects are accepted and they both
    raise TypeError if an object of another type is passed.

About the general novaclient changes:

    In order to better support non-ASCII characters, it is a good
    practice to use unicode interanlly and encode everything that has to
    go out. This patch aims to do that and introduces this behaviour in
    the client.

Testing:

    A good test (besides using tox) is to use nova client with and
    without setting any locale (export LANG=).

Fixes bug: 1061156

Change-Id: I20b75e42b0c3dac89f1048faa1127253a64f86c7
"}, {'created': '2013-02-28 08:18:19.000000000', 'message': "Decodes input and encodes output

Currently novaclient doesn't handle properly incoming and outgoing
encode / decode process. As a solution for this, this patch implements a
decoding process for all data incoming from the user side and decodes
everything going out of the client, i.e: http requests, prints, etc.

This patch introduces a new module (strutils.py) taken from
oslo-incubator in order to use 2 of the functions present in it:

About safe_(decode|encode):

    Both functions try to encode / decode the incoming text using the
    stdin encoding, fallback to python's default encoding if that
    returns None or to UTF-8 as the last option.

    In both functions only basestring objects are accepted and they both
    raise TypeError if an object of another type is passed.

About the general novaclient changes:

    In order to better support non-ASCII characters, it is a good
    practice to use unicode interanlly and encode everything that has to
    go out. This patch aims to do that and introduces this behaviour in
    the client.

Testing:

    A good test (besides using tox) is to use nova client with and
    without setting any locale (export LANG=).

Fixes bug: 1061156

Change-Id: I20b75e42b0c3dac89f1048faa1127253a64f86c7

commit_message:
Decodes input and encodes output

Currently novaclient doesn't handle properly incoming and outgoing
encode / decode process. As a solution for this, this patch implements a
decoding process for all data incoming from the user side and decodes
everything going out of the client, i.e: http requests, prints, etc.

This patch introduces a new module (strutils.py) taken from
oslo-incubator in order to use 2 of the functions present in it:

About safe_(decode|encode):

    Both functions try to encode / decode the incoming text using the
    stdin encoding, fallback to python's default encoding if that
    returns None or to UTF-8 as the last option.

    In both functions only basestring objects are accepted and they both
    raise TypeError if an object of another type is passed.

About the general novaclient changes:

    In order to better support non-ASCII characters, it is a good
    practice to use unicode interanlly and encode everything that has to
    go out. This patch aims to do that and introduces this behaviour in
    the client.

Testing:

    A good test (besides using tox) is to use nova client with and
    without setting any locale (export LANG=).

Fixes bug: 1061156

Change-Id: I20b75e42b0c3dac89f1048faa1127253a64f86c7

commit_message:
Fix test_flavor_extra_specs

This commit makes a number of changes to test_flavors_extra_specs
that cleans up a few of the tests in the file. Firstly, the
test_flavor_non_admin_set_get_unset_keys is split up into 3
separate tests. The original method, besides not working, was
testing 3 different permission cases. Secondly, an unused import
was removed. Thirdly, attrs were added for the negative tests in
the file. Lastly, all the try except blocks for the negative
tests were removed.

Change-Id: I4beba91918fc795628f2668b196a3bb150a610d8

commit_message:
Remove skips for fixed bugs.

This commit removes skips from tests for bugs that have been fixed.
This currently unskips:

 - volume.admin.test_volume_types_extra_specs_negative:test_update_no_body
 - compute.images.test_images_oneserver:test_create_image_specify_name_over_256_chars

Also, the volume_types_client was updated to enable test_update_no_body
running. The extra_specs update method previously couldn't handle the
blank input from the negative test.

Change-Id: If13125bf5c0635b6190f1385e88d234db7a4156e

commit_message:
Fixes incorrect constant value in haproxy config

quantum/plugins/services/agent_loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/cfg.py#L31
constants.PROTOCOL_HTTPS: 'tcp',

seems like this should be:
constants.PROTOCOL_HTTPS: 'https'

Bug #1153134

commit_message:
Add force-delete option for volumes

Again, looking thorouhgly through cinders commands, i noticed
an force-delete command, which was for volumes only.
Decided it would work best as an optional argument for the
regular delete case

commit_message:
Use correct cache setting with swift authtoken

fixes bug 1131433

As noted in the bug report, bad things happen if
the wrong cache value is used with the authtoken
filter.

See associated update in swift repo:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22615

Change-Id: I979a9d7bce12867b3ec2dc303c4df74678ee9798

commit_message:
Add information about pluggable auth handlers

fixes bug 1084497

This patch adds a new file and includes it from the common
keystone chapter. Grizzly brings the ability to use the auth
handlers from apache-httpd, and this change takes docs from
the keystone repo to make them available for operators.

Change-Id: Ife00dfb48ec717598b545ee1ffc1ccccaa89b6ad

commit_message:
Run keystone server in debug mode.

keystone currently not able be to started in
debug mode because pydev package in
pycharm-debug.egg is removed. Fix is provided
with the correct import statement.

Fixes Bug #1135306

Change-Id: I5588b768a4807b79ae1dabd7550cbee7d2c7505e

gyee: This isn't intended to conflict with your patch. Your bug is regarding the time format itself, this bug is against the name of the attribute"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-01 16:02:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I was fixing both attribute and time format inconsistencies for expires_at and issued_at. I am OK with fixing them as two separate bugs."}, {'account_id': 4992, 'date': '2013-03-01 19:59:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4992, 'date': '2013-03-01 20:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-01 20:35:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-01 21:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/6/check/gate-keystone-pep8/3894 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/6/check/gate-keystone-docs/2330 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/6/check/gate-keystone-python26/2858 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/6/check/gate-keystone-python27/2867 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/6494 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/6213 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/11336 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4992, 'date': '2013-03-01 22:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

This has become a philosophical discussion, my preference being change only the external facing point to minimally meet the API spec. No confusion, internally, in DB schema, back-end blobs, and everywhere else, the data item is just "expires". If we agree there is confusion, then in Havana, change everything to expires-at. I did notice mysql table column "expire" in token table.
Regards
Malini'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-01 23:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

We are not changing the column name. What I suggested does not violate existing schema. See

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/auth/token_factory.py#L223

Token "expires" column is still in the dictionary for token creation. Also see 

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/token/backends/sql.py#L51

I agreed wholeheartedly that we shouldn't be changing backend schema at this point. But lets clean up the rest to the extent as possible. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 4992, 'date': '2013-03-01 23:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I would argue that it does not require further clean-up at this point. Your examples of the db schema not changing lend support to my point. With the minimal change there is just one location where we have expire-at, versus a mix of expires and expires-at and deep knowledge of when something gets mapped to the DB and when not.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-02 00:56:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

For PKI tokens, "expires_at" is part of the signature. I don't think we have a choice here.

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/auth/token_factory.py#L202'}, {'account_id': 4992, 'date': '2013-03-02 01:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Smiles, with this you convinced me. I will also look into adding a test to check token-id.'}, {'account_id': 4992, 'date': '2013-03-02 01:35:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

token-id in its signed incarnation actually opens up more questions:
1)  expiry = token_data['token']['expires']
        if isinstance(expiry, basestring):
            expiry = timeutils.parse_isotime(expiry)

If expiry is of type basestring, on conversion, if one tried to reconstruct a signature, it would not match the token id created a few steps earlier using:

token_id = cms.cms_sign_token(json.dumps(token_data),
                                      CONF.signing.certfile,
                                      CONF.signing.keyfile).

2) the database backend implementations also check whether the expires information is provided, else, will set it to default_expire_time. Once again if one tries to check token-id signature against a post filled expires time field, cannot expect it to match.

This then prompts the question when the above paths would be encountered. If indeed token-id signature will be checked, in these two scenarios there would be a failure."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-03-04 03:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

1) expiry is not part of the signature. Only token_data is. You may want to do this instead.

expiry = token_data['token'].get('expires_at', token_data['token']['expires'])

This would ensure continuity between Grizzly-3 and RC-1 tokens.

2) default time is never needed as "expires_at" will always present in token_data.'}, {'account_id': 4992, 'date': '2013-03-06 11:32:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-06 12:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/7/check/gate-keystone-pep8/4033 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/7/check/gate-keystone-docs/2458 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23215/7/check/gate-keystone-python26/2984 : SUCCESS

But puzzled by a curl example:
http://localhost:35357/v2.0/tokens, while for v3, we use 
http://localhost:35357/v3/tokens  instead of v3.0

Why the difference?

Is it too late in the day to introduce version numbers into tokens? commit_message:
Make Keystone return v3 as part of the version api

The keystone "get version" api currently fails to list v3
as a supported api.  It should now do this, along with v2 (which is,
of course, still supported)

Fixes Bug #1148186

Change-Id: Ie88bf941123702d2f7e2ecf6cecb1fa937ca1e52

commit_message:
Update oslo rpc libraries

Update oslo rpc libraries to capture changes, primarly motivated
by secret=True flag on password config options.

Change-Id: I8481aef8fc3c99b96dfd83b8089930d201c0f3c1

commit_message:
Make getting user-domain roles backend independant

There is nothing backend specific in geting the list of roles
for a user-domain, so we should move this function into backends
core.  This also has the affect of now ensuring that the kvs and ldap
support will work, provided the specific backend supports roles on
users and domains.  This is true today for kvs, but support in ldap
for domains is gated by other bugs.

Fixes bug #1131769

Change-Id: Id99accb33fd7cd8d6c37e64e140552c5bfe68349

properly raise in cases where there is no root or multiple
roots.

Fixes LP Bug #1153414.

commit_message:
Correct exception args in vfs/guestfs.

Updates the exception formatting in vfs/guestfs so that we
properly raise in cases where there is no root or multiple
roots.

Fixes a TypeError that would occur with the previous code.

Fixes LP Bug #1153414.

Change-Id: I28f9cde5a2da466ebb7397176baaf051ccd4192b

commit_message:
Update oslo rpc libraries

Update oslo rpc libraries to capture changes, primarly motivated
by secret=True flag on password config options. Skipping broken,
invalid test case while working on correct fix.

Change-Id: Ibb979189b4a6215f307cb49e4a17070ffc7f0f51

commit_message:
Add basic intro to swift ACLs

fixes bug 994657

This patch adds a basic introduction to swift ACLs,
including examples using the swift cli tool. Previously,
this was undocumented.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-10 02:07:02.000000000', 'message': "Removes misleading note in quantum doc

fixes bug 1134849

As precisely report by Stephen Gordon in the bug report,
different quantum plugins use different databases with one
exception. As we're trying to reduce the cruft in the docs
and no longer cover every single exception, removing both
instances of the note.

Change-Id: If6e553bad6b1a4e78f29c859dfb69d84fd9aa609
"}]
commit_message:
Removes misleading note in quantum doc

fixes bug 1134849

As precisely report by Stephen Gordon in the bug report,
different quantum plugins use different databases with one
exception. As we're trying to reduce the cruft in the docs
and no longer cover every single exception, removing both
instances of the note.

Change-Id: If6e553bad6b1a4e78f29c859dfb69d84fd9aa609

Doc glance hw_ namespace for hardware properties

fixes bug 1153470

As noted in the bug report, glance hardware properties now use
'hw_' as a namespace. There was only one reference to this in
the docs, which this patch updates.

commit_message:
Fix wrong port in metadata example

fixes bug 1095423

As reported in the bug, the NAT line for metadata should be using
port 8775 instead of 8773 for correct access. Also updated
the instructions to use a later version of ubuntu

Change-Id: I186b60c458cfdddf7080657ca73b406ea0d00d06

commit_message:
Add missing packages to swift proxy install line

fixes bug 1153402

As reported in the bug, without these additional packages
added to the line by this change, swift-proxy will fail to start
causing panic for new installers.

Change-Id: Ifce07e6d0e1b2196ecb62e60454077fd4e2ca5de

commit_message:
Adding auditor speed limits to config reference

fixes bug 1153473

Grizzly adds two options for account/container auditor:
- containers_per_second: Maximum containers audited per second
- accounts_per_second: Maximum accounts audited per second

this patch adds them to the config reference.

Change-Id: I007305847fee61401a275d78ac7bdb824e0151cb

commit_message:
Recognise arn: for REST stack lookup.

Note that the Routes mapper does brittle regexp fu to map parameters,
hence using \x3A for matching a colon

Fixes: Bug #1131759
Change-Id: I063bf9057782c1c0a3f809d4f8068e2594be264d

assign same IP to multiple different requests.

Change-Id: Idbb04d3ce6eacd308b05536f1942a35a0792199e
"}]
commit_message:
Lock tables for update on allocation/deletion

Allocating, creating and deleting port might happen
in parallel and we need to make sure we don't
assign same IP to multiple different requests.

Added treatment for vlan tags and tunnel ID's

Fixes: bug #1110807

Change-Id: Idbb04d3ce6eacd308b05536f1942a35a0792199e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-11 08:22:18.000000000', 'message': 'Update tox.ini to support RHEL 6.x.

In order to support running unit tests on RHEL 6.x we need to patch
eventlet with contrib/redhat-eventlet.patch. We already
have support for this in the tools/install_venv_common.py but we
need to make a couple changes to allow tox to consume this:

1) Sync in the latest intall_venv_common.py from oslo. This changes
 patch to use the -N option (ignore already applied patches) and
 makes it safe to call the patching function more than once.

2) Add a new patch_tox_venv.py script in tools.

3) Update tox.ini to call patch_tox_venv.py before it runs tests and
 coverage.

NOTE: This will hopefully go away eventually once this patch lands:

 https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/89/add-a-timeout-argument-to-subprocesspopen#comment-3342969

Change-Id: I3e2b07c3f718e4aede5c5f231ff0cdb7721ec885

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to support RHEL 6.x.

In order to support running unit tests on RHEL 6.x we need to patch
eventlet with contrib/redhat-eventlet.patch. We already
have support for this in the tools/install_venv_common.py but we
need to make a couple changes to allow tox to consume this:

1) Sync in the latest intall_venv_common.py from oslo. This changes
 patch to use the -N option (ignore already applied patches) and
 makes it safe to call the patching function more than once.

2) Add a new patch_tox_venv.py script in tools.

3) Update tox.ini to call patch_tox_venv.py before it runs tests and
 coverage.

NOTE: This will hopefully go away eventually once this patch lands:

 https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/89/add-a-timeout-argument-to-subprocesspopen#comment-3342969

Change-Id: I3e2b07c3f718e4aede5c5f231ff0cdb7721ec885

commit_message:
Stop using --stat for ChangeLog.

It takes 15 seconds to generate the ChangeLog for nova. Without --stat,
it takes 0.5 seconds. Removing this makes using tox in nova about the
same speed as using install_venv/with_venv.

Change-Id: I626d5e788bfaf1a80b91d845f21af54680f81c35

subject: call new Resource.active() method on requierments
messages:
[{'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-02-23 02:04:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-02-26 23:18:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-02-26 23:50:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:37:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-02-27 04:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (5 inline comments)

Thanks for the feedback, I will address these issues soon!'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-02-27 12:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not merge

(1 inline comment)

As a quick hack for Autoscaling groups, this approach is too complicated.

As a stepping-stone to a long-term goal of parallel creation for all resource types, this approach will not work. (e.g. there is no way for this to handle nested stacks). It's also far too complicated.

Resource subclasses should never be manipulating the state machine directly; that is completely unmaintainable - remember that there will be resource plugins that are out-of-tree that we have no control over. We need to make this interface as simple (and stable!) as possible.

BTW this patch is missing the changes to Stack.update() to bring it in line with Stack.create(), but I assume that was intentional to get some reviews done first. Just making a note of it.


The key to any future parallel creation system based on co-routines (i.e. avoiding threads) is to do any waiting in the *caller*, not in the resource.

Here is my suggestion for a quick hack:
1) Add a Resource.is_active() method, that returns true by default. An is_active()->handle_is_active() split will probably make things easier for the autoscaling case.
2) For now, change Resource.create() to busy-wait poll self.is_active() after calling self.handle_create(). Note that the sleeping is done in Resource.create(), not in Instance.handle_is_active().
3) Add an Instance.handle_is_active() method to poll nova for the status. Move all of the polling code from handle_create(). No changes to exception handling would be required.
4) Add a GroupedInstance.create() method that overrides Resource.is_active() such that it does not call handle_is_active() but simply returns True. The autoscaling group can then poll handle_is_active() itself after launching all of the instances. (For bonus points, it could do this in its own handle_is_active() method, at least in the create case.)

Note that (1+2), (3) and (4) should be separate patches.

And for future evolution:
5) Turn Resource.create() into a co-routine by doing yield instead of sleep(), so that any waiting will then be done in *its* caller.

Note that even this approach will require extreme hackery to handle nested stacks (using the handle_is_active() calls to drive the create co-routine for the nested stack <shudder>), and I am reasonably certain we will end up having to use threads anyway. But at least this way we would not be adding too much complexity to the resources in the meantime.


Setting -2 as this patch is not proposed for Grizzly. Perhaps mark it as "Work in Progress" in Gerrit?'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-03-03 20:55:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

Setting WIP, will likely refactor after Zane's changes that do similar things."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-11 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-11 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
call new Resource.active() method on requierments

If a resource does not block until active on create(), it can optionally
implement an active() method which does block until ACTIVE. We call this
method whenever a resource is required by another resource that wants to
be created. We also call it for all resources at the end of the stack to
make sure all resources are completely created.

Fixes bug #1130971

Change-Id: I7d4ab6eeb1b1ee889aaf6d8bde9de5b18aa56479

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 22:41:45.000000000', 'message': "LIO iSCSI initiator ACL auto-config

Currently, IQNs of remote nova compute nodes must be specified in
cinder.conf for them to be added to LIO's ACLs for LUNs.

This change will handle this at volume-attach time instead.

commit_message:
LIO iSCSI initiator ACL auto-config

Currently, IQNs of remote nova compute nodes must be specified in
cinder.conf for them to be added to LIO's ACLs for LUNs.

This change will handle this at volume-attach time instead.

Change-Id: I278ce737042b15bd4d100d331564c1377bac0c55

commit_message:
Prevents flavors to be deleted when reusing a name

Adds an extra check to the EditFlavor form
in order to avoid losing the flavor if an
existing name is setted as the new name.

This control is needed because the current
edit implementation is based in a
delete-create action.

Change-Id: I4251c64fa4719831a1ed949bf95349a350dd303d
Fixes: bug #1133254

Fixes bug: 1153274

Due to a bug in setting up external ports the Hyper-V agent fails to work in
scenarios with VLAN and flat networks.

port settings are ignored. As a result the agent can be simplified by
avoiding vswitch external ports configurations.

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V agent issue with mixed network types

Fixes bug: 1153274

Due to a bug in setting up external ports the Hyper-V agent fails to work in
scenarios with VLAN and flat networks.

Furthermore, a warning message on Hyper-V 2012 indicates that external
port settings are ignored. As a result the agent can be simplified by
avoiding vswitch external ports configurations.

Change-Id: I860d22f427cb10dbeac422c1db2b3bcf9e84150f

commit_message:
Update to Quantum Client 2.2.0

This patch updates tools/pip-requires to use the python-quantumclient 2.2
It also limits the version to <3.0.0 to prevent breaking something accidently
when 3.0.0 is released.

Fixes bug 1152695

Change-Id: If47e5bf1d638a2ac87d523651060fc7859bf8049

[{'created': '2013-03-08 17:49:07.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : store stack on failed update

Store the stack even when the update fails, otherwise we
lose track of the resources which failed on create so they
are not removed on stack delete

fixes bug 1151989

Change-Id: Ic8aa5ef92e188fb704ed25563aa9b86aa69232b4
'}]
commit_message:
heat engine : store stack on failed update

Store the stack even when the update fails, otherwise we
lose track of the resources which failed on create so they
are not removed on stack delete

fixes bug 1151989

Change-Id: Ic8aa5ef92e188fb704ed25563aa9b86aa69232b4

commit_message:
Remove the distinction between a storage engine and connection.

It's unused, and leaves storage plugins in-consistent with all other plugin types.

Change-Id: I4c304c253a37dbd5ea29cbc58d64d932483aeb78

commit_message:
Update keystone middleware in cinder api-paste:

cinder-api in trunk will no longer start with
keystone.middleware, only with keystoneclient.middleware.

The issue is discussed here:
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1143998

Change-Id: I29f81ca2503957b4df58e86b2392ef4b3c15d6fe

commit_message:
Fix a few bugs for LeftHand Grizzly

This patch fixes a few issues with the LH driver.
1) attach wasn't working because there was no host
created.
2) get_volume_stats didn't exist.
3) fixed the unit tests to work with the new config
access.

Bug 1062508
Bug 1150663

Change-Id: I6f80c3d5c70b64ca6496e50fedcb6b3ca0e2be43

commit_message:
Fix calling setUp() method of superclass from tearDown method.

In test_netapp.py, the tearDown function was calling setUp of
superclass instead of calling tearDown of superclass. Fixed it
here.

Change-Id: Iab65e60193edcd47d09d7788b0951ef66d816e38

commit_message:
Fix volume capacity reporting

cinder-volume crashes when the decimal point is not represented by a dot
but by a comma instead. This crash happens for example with the de_DE
locale.

This change replaces any comma appearing in the vgs command output with
a dot.

Test case added.

Fixes: bug #1151684
Change-Id: I831055fb7fd206a8560688ec4c25d766e92ee0f0

commit_message:
Remove test dep on name of dir (bug 1124283)

The name of the project's directory was previously hardcoded into the
tests, so tests would fail if executed from another directory (such as
"python-keystoneclient-master", as checked-out by keystone for
integration testing).

Also, the tests should now be executable on Windows.

Change-Id: I0a1e052054e509b0f795fd13f95a804e0c255907

commit_message:
Add baremetal to the CLI guide.

Add baremetal actions to the CLI guide, and add some samples showing how
to add baremetal nodes and interfaces.

Fixes bug 1133448

Also, cleans up the indentation in nova_cli_commands for readability.

Change-Id: I51e3253896b934df5e7b60fee62efc2fd1f38ef4

commit_message:
Check CONF values *after* command line args are parsed

CONF.ssl_only will contain the default value till
parse_args is called.

Fix for LP# 1123540

Fix unnecessary dependency on quantumclient

Import quantum_driver only if quantum security group api's are
enabled

Fix LP# 1136632

subject: Make bm model's deleted column match database
messages:
[{'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-03-07 22:41:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Could you clarify the commit message slightly? Eg, indicate that the baremetal tables are this way due to legacy, not design, and we'll change these to Integer in a future patch.

Also, I'd love to see a test for this that confirms it works on Postgres (but I'm not sure how to do that, and without a migration, which we don't need, it may not be possible).

Otherwise, LGTM :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 23:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Boris and I looked at ways to test this, and I wasn't happy with anything we came up with:
- add a _check_001 does not actually test the fix
- add a _check_004 would work, but is misleading, since this fix is unrelated to migration 004
- a unit test won't work, because this issue only shows up with Postgres

So, I'm OK with this landing without a corresponding test case -- it's just bringing the baremetal/db/sqlalchemy/models.py file in sync with the existing migrations. 

Also, we have to come back in early Havana and actually fix the behaviour of deleted columns, ie. make the baremetal db code support soft deletes and unique indexes in the same way nova db code does."}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-03-08 19:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-03-08 19:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 22:24:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deleted columns types in bm models

By default type of deleted column is Integer, but baremetal tabels
use Boolean type for deleted columns.

This produce bug in postgresql (type mismatch)

Fixes bug 1140294

Change-Id: Id56c4bbff7048ed5c746dc995380be9ba0a12c39
'}, {'created': '2013-03-08 19:40:47.000000000', 'message': "Make bm model's deleted column match database

In Models by default type of deleted column is Integer, but bm tabels
use Boolean type for deleted columns.This produce bug in postgresql
(type mismatch).

At this moment we are not able to do any db migrations, so there is
only one way to fix this bug. Change type of deleted columns in Models
from Integer to Boolean.

In Havana we will be able to change deleted columns types to type of id
for bm tables and use soft_delete and UC as in rest of nova.

Fixes bug 1140294

Change-Id: Id56c4bbff7048ed5c746dc995380be9ba0a12c39
"}]
commit_message:
Make bm model's deleted column match database

In Models by default type of deleted column is Integer, but bm tabels
use Boolean type for deleted columns.This produce bug in postgresql
(type mismatch).

At this moment we are not able to do any db migrations, so there is
only one way to fix this bug. Change type of deleted columns in Models
from Integer to Boolean.

In Havana we will be able to change deleted columns types to type of id
for bm tables and use soft_delete and UC as in rest of nova.

Fixes bug 1140294

Change-Id: Id56c4bbff7048ed5c746dc995380be9ba0a12c39

commit_message:
Add a tool which runs elements locally:

This tool, `bin/run-elements-locally`, accepts a list
of element names, and runs their pre-install, install,
and first-boot scripts locally.

This useful for testing and development purposes.

Change-Id: I1ba92d62f18b0fd934bf4cb181f83527eb381f87

commit_message:
Improvements to glance element:

- Perform config installation with os-config-applier
- Known-working config files
- Perform service restarts using os-refresh-config hooks
- Collapse g-api and g-reg into a single element, at least for now

Change-Id: Ie40c9725cbc27445e10ffde8eeff422bd121d5b5

commit_message:
Remove uses of instance['instance_type'] from nova/notifications

This is one change in a series aimed at removing the use of instance-linked
instance_type objects, in favor of the decoupled type data in
system_metadata. See bug 1140119 for more details.

Change-Id: Iebbb0fa0bf306d6a7c8b83594e13a4b99f27c404

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 18:49:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add MultipleCreate template and fix conflict with other templates

This patch creates a dedicated xml template to the os-multiple-create extension
when using return_reservation_id=True in the request. The previous code, with
all extensions loaded, conflicted with security_groups extension.

There is also a change in the response due to the new Template, but the only
information removed is an empty metadata field (which made the previous xml
output even more inconsisten with json). The consistency between json and xml
will be treated in the next api version.

DocImpact

Fixes bug 1149526

Change-Id: I3ca0129086ff1df3a8faa2b3b8bd959c9b74103c
'}]
commit_message:
Add MultipleCreate template and fix conflict with other templates

This patch creates a dedicated xml template to the os-multiple-create extension
when using return_reservation_id=True in the request. The previous code, with
all extensions loaded, conflicted with security_groups extension.

There is also a change in the response due to the new Template, but the only
information removed is an empty metadata field (which made the previous xml
output even more inconsisten with json). The consistency between json and xml
will be treated in the next api version.

DocImpact

Fixes bug 1149526

Change-Id: I3ca0129086ff1df3a8faa2b3b8bd959c9b74103c

[{'created': '2013-03-09 15:31:09.000000000', 'message': 'NVP plugin: return 409 if wrong router interface info on remove

Bug 1152167

Raise an exception causing a 409 error to be returned if port_id or
subnet_id specified in request body do not exist before further
processing the operation (which will cause a 500 error to be
returned to the user)

Change-Id: I347dd86da87ce5b1e57e139e4c21d4533a456cbc
'}]
commit_message:
NVP plugin: return 409 if wrong router interface info on remove

Bug 1152167

Raise an exception causing a 409 error to be returned if port_id or
subnet_id specified in request body do not exist before further
processing the operation (which will cause a 500 error to be
returned to the user)

Change-Id: I347dd86da87ce5b1e57e139e4c21d4533a456cbc

commit_message:
Fix instance evacuate with shared storage

Fixes instance evacuation problem when --on-shared-storage flag
specified. The problem occurs as the password variable ends up being
accessed before it is assigned. Also adds missing test case.

Fixes bug 1152492

Change-Id: I461c0f7fcf8835028f7529a7860fb330d1759d68

commit_message:
Ensure metadata access network does not prevent router deletion

Bug 1152136

This patch checks if a metadata access network is still present when
removing a router in the NVP plugin. If yes, the network is detached
from the router and then destroyed, thus ensuring a safe completion of
the operation as well as removal of metadata access network resources.

Change-Id: Id8be6ec50ab4536f4ae9916dadaed56644597c7c

commit_message:
Nova network needs to take care of existing alias

Nova network should take care of existing aliases on bridge
interfaces when it adds address on top of the list.

Change-Id: Ife54c9eba64906406f7c44a66b596f3162ad16b6
Fixes: bug #1077066

commit_message:
Correct substring matching of baremetal VPD node names

This path corrects a issue where is_power_on function can incorrectly match a
node if its name is a substring of another node.

I have also added a test for this.

fixes bug 1152676
Change-Id: Ic3b0b952d53dcd4464098f98879a84684efe22b2
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

We should account for both cases.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 18:10:38.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent rescue for volume-backed instances

This patch prevents rescuing of volume_backed instances, by checking
for it in the API layer and raising an exception if instance on which a
rescue was attempted is volume backed.

Rescue is supposed to just be a way to log into a wayward instance
if something goes wrong with the base image that may have had some data
(logfiles etc.) and make it possible to grab that - block devices are
assumed to be accessible by re-attaching them, and are considered
persistant so no need for rescue there.

Fixes bug: #1067744
blueprint: improve-boot-from-volume

Change-Id: I8a4b1ccff7406837de3086aa413034e8e647b8fa
'}, {'created': '2013-03-07 19:19:32.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent rescue for volume-backed instances

(logfiles etc.) and make it possible to grab that - block devices are
assumed to be accessible by re-attaching them, and are considered
persistant so no need for rescue there.

Fixes bug: #1067744
blueprint: improve-boot-from-volume

commit_message:
Prevent rescue for volume-backed instances

This patch prevents rescuing of volume_backed instances, by checking
for it in the API layer and raising an exception if instance on which a
rescue was attempted is volume backed.

Rescue is supposed to just be a way to log into a wayward instance
if something goes wrong with the base image that may have had some data
(logfiles etc.) and make it possible to grab that - block devices are
assumed to be accessible by re-attaching them, and are considered
persistant so no need for rescue there.

Fixes bug: #1067744
blueprint: improve-boot-from-volume

Change-Id: I8a4b1ccff7406837de3086aa413034e8e647b8fa

"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-03-09 08:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

During writing the unit tests, I encoutered the problem that 
supported_extension_aliases is not reset across tests when supported_extension_aliases is modified in the instance constructor. I use imp.reload() to deal with it, but I think it is not a better solution. It would be great if anyone let me know the real cause.

Thanks,
Akihiro'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-03-09 08:34:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I noticed that it is very problematic to change the class variable 'supported_extension_aliases' in unit tests since a loaded plugin class is reused in unit tests. On a deployment environment a plugin class is loaded only once and it is not a problem.  It means that supported_extension_aliases needs to be reset to the default value after each test finished, but it affects many tests and it should be avoided at this moment.

Though I think it is good to disable security group extension when quantum security group actually does nothing, this change may cause degradation in unit tests, so I start to think this patch should be abandoned."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-03-09 08:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-03-09 08:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-03-09 08:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Disable secgroup extension when Noop Firewall driver is used

When Noop Firewall driver is used, Quantum security group actually does
nothing in OVS and Linux Bridge plugin. It would be better to disable
security group extension for such case to avoid confusion.
By this we can determine whether quantum security group is enabled
by checking the extension list.
This commit changes OVS/LB/NEC/Ryu plugins with agent firewall_driver
based security group implementation.

Fixes bug #1124117

Change-Id: I2182289c1e27987b686f1adb7d6e2ad4e154caa2

I apologise but this is only a 'reduced' version of the real fix (see commit message).

The problem I have with the 'complete' fix is that it's tricky to know which IP on a port for which device_owner==network:router_interface is the one connected to the router interface.

If I just prevent the update with a check similar to delete_port a lot of tests start failing.
If I do something smarter which checks only if 'gateway' IPs are being updated this still does not take into account the case in which an arbitrary port is added to a router.

I will file separate patches for these issues. As this patch addresses the most pressing one, we can probably just merge this for RC1. Also because I can anticipate the complete solution has a diff > 50 lines (about 150 with unit tests)"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-03-09 08:30:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Failing unit tests are not properly cleaning up router interfaces, so they will crash because this fix prevents the subnet from being delete while it's attached to a router."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-03-09 08:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FIY, current full diff is here:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/33078/

(note: causes unit tests failures)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-09 08:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Bug 1152171

This patch simply causes a 409 to be returned when attempting to
delete a subnet which has IPs on ports whose device_owner is
network:router_interface

This does not address a similar problem that arises when the ips for
a port owned by a router_interface are updated. This problem is hidden

commit_message:
Do not delete subnets with IPs on router interfaces

Bug 1152171

This patch simply causes a 409 to be returned when attempting to
delete a subnet which has IPs on ports whose device_owner is
network:router_interface

This does not address a similar problem that arises when the ips for
a port owned by a router_interface are updated. This problem is hidden
when updating a port which has been assigned the gateway_ip by an
exception in the IP recycling process. However, it will hit when the
port was explicitly added to the router, since it will have an ip
different from the subnet's gateway ip.

Change-Id: I38dfd2639acd03db8d3f1f933495a456a4a8724f

commit_message:
Remove openstack.common.exception.

The code in this module does some extremely quesitonable things,
such as catching an exception and raising a completely new one. Nobody
should ever do that.

Change-Id: I49244b89c8ec9fde26de5252a8f783035ea932e1

commit_message:
Run hacking.py on tools.

Now that it's in oslo, we should run it on itself. As part of this, inject
--ignore=E125 as a default ignore in hacking, because nobody in the project
wants E125.

Change-Id: Iff3ee5a9bcafbcc8fcfa9f4cfb054f6e28e80b3a

Various modules in oslo are dependent on others.
For example, the notifier is dependent on rpc,
while rpc itself is dependent on *many* other modules.

When updating a project using update.py for a module,
update all modules on which the updated module depends.

commit_message:
Recursive dependency resolution for update.py

Various modules in oslo are dependent on others.
For example, the notifier is dependent on rpc,
while rpc itself is dependent on *many* other modules.

When updating a project using update.py for a module,
update all modules on which the updated module depends.

Change-Id: Ic46af6cc3076824e5716db94d110ecca01a4cab7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-26 00:46:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes bug 1131458

Fixes bugs in the test suite tempest.tests.network.test_networks that prevents
Jenkins gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum-full to execute succesfully. The
fundamental problem was that the aforementioned test suite was using v1.0 of
the Quantum API, which is not available anymore. The test suite was patched to
use operations in the current v2.0 of the Quantum API. This required patches in
the following files:

1) tempest.common.rest_client was patched to provide the correct end-point for
v2.0 of the Quantum API

2) tempest.services.network.json.network_client was patched to issue network
and subnet requests to v2.0 of the Quantum API

3) tempest.tests.network.base was patched to create a network and a subnet
using v2.0 Quantum API operations. Various minor bugs were also fixed

4) tempest.tests.network.test_networks was patched to invoke v2.0 Quantum API
operations. Individual tests invoking obsolete operations were eliminated

Change-Id: I78b5247dae7394c4439f6fe7cd74f79e7bdadd67

commit_message:
Update test_networks.py to v2.0 of Quantum API

Submitting again for review after Django v1.5 caused gate tests to fail on Feb
26th

Fixes bugs in the test suite tempest.tests.network.test_networks that prevents
Jenkins gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum-full to execute succesfully. The
fundamental problem was that the aforementioned test suite was using v1.0 of
the Quantum API, which is not available anymore. The test suite was patched to
use operations in the current v2.0 of the Quantum API. This required patches in
the following files:

1) tempest.common.rest_client was patched to provide the correct end-point for
v2.0 of the Quantum API

2) tempest.services.network.json.network_client was patched to issue network
and subnet requests to v2.0 of the Quantum API

3) tempest.tests.network.base was patched to create a network and a subnet
using v2.0 Quantum API operations. Various minor bugs were also fixed

4) tempest.tests.network.test_networks was patched to invoke v2.0 Quantum API
operations. Individual tests invoking obsolete operations were eliminated

Fixes bug 1131458

Change-Id: I78b5247dae7394c4439f6fe7cd74f79e7bdadd67

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-09 06:03:01.000000000', 'message': "Add check for subnet update with conflict gateway and allocation_pools

Fixes: bug 1062061

The patch will raise exception 'GatewayConflictWithAllocationPools' when
subnet update with conflict gateway and allocation_pools.

Because before validate gateway ip with conflict allocation pools, we need
validate allocation pools first. Move the validation of allocation pools
into _validate_subnet. Then_allocate_pools_for_subnet is only responsible
for pools allocation, and_validate_subnet is responsible for most validate
for subnet.

Change-Id: I8dffe45ce5c02e8e6c317bad470054564538bcf2
"}]
commit_message:
Add check for subnet update with conflict gateway and allocation_pools

Fixes: bug 1062061

The patch will raise exception 'GatewayConflictWithAllocationPools' when
subnet update with conflict gateway and allocation_pools.

Because before validate gateway ip with conflict allocation pools, we need
validate allocation pools first. Move the validation of allocation pools
into _validate_subnet. Then_allocate_pools_for_subnet is only responsible
for pools allocation, and_validate_subnet is responsible for most validate
for subnet.

Change-Id: I8dffe45ce5c02e8e6c317bad470054564538bcf2

Thanks for the feedback. I'll get this fixed up accordingly."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-03-08 20:06:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I spent some time considering the options here. Eliminating the callback (which is the correct approach) is going to impact every single code path outside of LVM, which I'm not comfortable doing this late if we're targeting a fix for Grizzly.

If I were to change the way the callback were used, I'd need to remove the path check in the callback function and perform that same check conditionally everywhere prepare_template() is referenced. Again, a lot more change than I'm comfortable making.

My preference would be to accept this code as-is for Grizzly and create a new bug to refactor this code for Havana."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-08 20:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

[{'created': '2013-03-01 09:02:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix ephemeral devices on LVM don't get mkfs'd

Fixes bug 1083424

Updated imagebackend to run the necessary callback conditionally
based on whether LVM is configured for use and ephemeral_size is
defined. The callback function was updated not to invoke qemu-img
for LVM, since the ephemeral disk is already present/created via
LVM. Lastly, the mkfs call had to be changed to be run as root,
since we are dealing with raw devices.

Change-Id: Ieb1febb0ea086f8e5063d92ca376d349fcd43a43

commit_message:
Fix ephemeral devices on LVM don't get mkfs'd

Fixes bug 1083424

Updated imagebackend to run the necessary callback conditionally
based on whether LVM is configured for use and ephemeral_size is
defined. The callback function was updated not to invoke qemu-img
for LVM, since the ephemeral disk is already present/created via
LVM. Lastly, the mkfs call had to be changed to be run as root,
since we are dealing with raw devices.

Change-Id: Ieb1febb0ea086f8e5063d92ca376d349fcd43a43
