[{'created': '2013-03-05 10:16:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Network object encoding issue when using qpid

When creating network via REST API will throw the exception
"CodecException: no encoding for
<nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.Network object at 0x4a8ea10>".
It only occurs when using qpid.
Fix this issue through using jsonutils.to_primitive method.

Fix bug 1143584.

Change-Id: I833aef451f8e3d5eaa246c19d67b2474a9d36910
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Network object encoding issue when using qpid

When creating network via REST API will throw the exception
"CodecException: no encoding for
<nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.Network object at 0x4a8ea10>".
It only occurs when using qpid.
Fix this issue through using jsonutils.to_primitive method.

Fix bug 1143584.

Change-Id: I833aef451f8e3d5eaa246c19d67b2474a9d36910

commit_message:
Additional "Unify Manager._update behaviour" cleanup

Make _update always return an instance of self.resource_class.

This is in preparation for fixing bug 1145768 by reverting the API
changes made in the original "Unify Manager._update behaviour" change.

This is to avoid needing to revert some of the cleanup that was made
in that change.

Change-Id: I842bda40a0dc168689a7dd8b88433c3cebef5839

'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-03-07 03:15:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think this will break compatibility with Postgres, which is case sensitive by default (IIUC, one must expclitly use the CITEXT type, or set some schema-wide flag, to be case-insensitive). Also, case (in)sensitivity is a client setting in MySQL, not a server setting; utf8-swedish-ci happens to be the default, but it is not in any way guaranteed that database string comparisons will be case-insensitive.

I think the proper solution is to either support case sensitivity through the whole stack, or to enforce all-lower-case identifiers at all entry points."}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-03-07 03:39:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

Suggestions inline. Hit me up in irc if something is unclear. matiu"}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-03-07 03:49:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Devananda van der Veen - what if we just changed the 'service_get_by_host_and_topic' sqlalchemy method to do a case-insensitive 'host' filter ?

A step towards making the whole stack case insensitive ?

Having mysql and postgres as supported backends with different settings for case sensitivity sure is a pain.

Perhaps we should investigate a policy of making all backend DBs be case sensitive to enforce consistency...:("}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-07 18:24:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Devananda, this patch defers to the DB layer for string matching, so if the DB is case sensitive, the entire stack will be.  Before the host_name came from the REST API, but with this patch the host_name comes from the DB (and if DB is case sensitive the DB layer will throw an error instead of returning the proper capitalization of the hostname).  

As for case sensitivity standards, RPC is currently case sensitive as are the inputs via WSGI, but DB isn't currently.  I think a better case sensitivity policy is a good topic for havana"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-07 18:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Matthew, new patch with your suggestions coming soon'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-03-07 19:25:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Joe, gotcha, thanks for clarifying that. So, yea, let's pick this up in Havana. I believe proper handling of case sensitivity is particularly important for i18n.

Will +1 when Matthew's comment is addressed"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-07 22:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-07 22:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 23:17:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Make 'os-hosts/node1' case sensitivity defer to DB

RPC is case sensitive, but URL is not, and DB can be. So pull host_name from DB
in HostAPI RPC layer instead of from passed in from URL.  This means RPC will
always get the proper capitalization, and case sensitivity is defined in DB layer.

Fix bug 996879

Change-Id: I448dd4ec3aec4af1adf4487f26ea996db572fa3d

* ReddwarfContext was changed to defer to the parent's to_dict method.
  When the context is serialized to amqp, it is known by the key 'auth_token'

commit_message:
Ensure to_dict() returns auth_tok

* ReddwarfContext was changed to defer to the parent's to_dict method.
  When the context is serialized to amqp, it is known by the key 'auth_token'
  instead of the expected 'auth_tok' as a side-effect.

fixes bug 1152827

Change-Id: I8fcdb2a3eaf8da0dda3c0229b24e32f528353619

commit_message:
Update to Quantum Client 2.2.0

This patch updates tools/pip-requires to use the python-quantumclient 2.2
It also limits the version to <3.0.0 to prevent breaking something accidently
when 3.0.0 is released.

Fixes bug 1152695

Change-Id: Iec52ffe91793567c7707843a80a282bd51eb0c76

commit_message:
Ensure subnets are released upon recieving net delete requests

issuing a quantum net-delete, without explicit quantum subnet-delete
call(s) before it, results in subnet level resources like ip addresses
not being released and also will not send out agent notification for
subnet-deletes.Current code in delete-network cleans up the db entries
for subnets but does not cleanup actual subnet resources

The proposed fix ensures subnets get cleaned up at net-delete. This will
release ip level resources and ensure quantum netns cleanup will not fail
for dhcp namespace.

Change-Id: I00e1000b9779350cd77d73c0b9d68df4c373b5fb
Fixes: bug#1052535

commit_message:
Remove uses of instance['instance_type'] from nova/scheduler

This is a tiny change in the actual code, but requires a bunch of
silly changes in the tests because we're so inconsistent with our
(ab)use of instance types there. This attempts to help clean that
up locally a bit.

This is one change in a series aimed at removing the use of instance-linked
instance_type objects, in favor of the decoupled type data in
system_metadata. See bug 1140119 for more details.

Change-Id: Ied1a944a7c762129597d18ded61ce1632657f070

commit_message:
Remove uses of instance['instance_type'] from nova/api

This removes a test that attempted to delete the data from the
instance['instance_type'] structure and confirm that the flavor can
still be fetched. Since this data is no longer consulted in that
action (and will be removed altogether soon), this test is removed.

This is one change in a series aimed at removing the use of instance-linked
instance_type objects, in favor of the decoupled type data in
system_metadata. See bug 1140119 for more details.

Change-Id: I3ba56f9419aece5b9269a181264d09b117ecdb81

commit_message:
Remove uses of instance['instance_type'] from nova/network

This is one change in a series aimed at removing the use of instance-linked
instance_type objects, in favor of the decoupled type data in
system_metadata. See bug 1140119 for more details.

Change-Id: I43c9e9b7d560d8803899360bd7142e393b793f3d

commit_message:
Remove uses of instance['instance_type'] from nova/compute

Note that some tests were verifying things that can no longer fail, namely
rebuilding instances who use flavors that have since been disabled. These
tests are removed here.

Also, this changes the order of a piece of logic in the resize/migrate
path where before we would have ended up checking the instance type that
we fetched from sys_meta to see if it was disabled (which makes no sense
now). Reversing the check (to see if we're doing a resize or a migrate
before checking the new flavor) eliminates the problem of the stashed
type not having the 'disabled' attribute.

This is one change in a series aimed at removing the use of instance-linked
instance_type objects, in favor of the decoupled type data in
system_metadata. See bug 1140119 for more details.

Change-Id: I214a693e3bb16c0a365eb9b3afe73601beba4a22

commit_message:
Remove uses of instance['instance_type'] from libvirt driver.

Note that this includes a few tweaks to the libvirt tests where the instance
type in use was expected to have no swap, but the actual id-matching fake
did. This integration makes it a little harder for the tests to be out
of whack like that, which is good.

This is one change in a series aimed at removing the use of instance-linked
instance_type objects, in favor of the decoupled type data in
system_metadata. See bug 1140119 for more details.

Change-Id: I190258bd0947944d9bcdf49956eed40d402606f5

commit_message:
Add explicit egress rules to nvp security profile

The following commit  7e26074b changed the previous behavior of quantum
security groups by explicitly adding egress rules to the security profile.
When these rules are removed the vm is no longer able to send traffic out.

This patch adds these rules for NVP. One thing to note in the patch
is that now a bunk rule of IPv4 127.0.0.1/32 is added to each security
profile. The reason for this is by default NVP security profiles allow
all egress traffic until a rule is added and then it just lets traffic
matching those rules out. Adding this bunk rule achieves this behavior
that quantum now uses.

Fixes bug 1150378

Change-Id: I005880fcf39d539ae99be428d75c43cc0b39a7b6

commit_message:
Add exception to swift-drive-audit if no date in line.

Sometimes there is no date at the beginning of a line in kern.log.
Although it does not happen often, there should be a check ensuring
the program doesn't crash in case it happens.

Added try-except block surrounding parsing string to date format.

Change-Id: I44a101266582eea2199189a006afa1037a9bd4ea
Fixes: bug #1152658

commit_message:
unable to load certificate should abort request

If openssl returns with a command line error (3), we assume
the PKI certificate is not properly installed.  Added
'try ... except' blocks to cms_sign_text and cms_sign_token
calls.

Fixes: bug #1103569
Change-Id: Iad98738e990d3ab1ec0d0015840d76cf948ae560

commit_message:
add domain, credential to identity v3 api

moved policy.py to it's own patch
minor changes based on comments
reworked it now that the domain specs have changed
added credential - create, delete, update, show, list
added domain - create, delete, update, show, list
update setup.py entry points

Change-Id: I6bbbb8fdfbc3e76ba75374e9579eb92c96c928fe

commit_message:
Remove uses of instance['instance_type'] from powervm driver.

This is one change in a series aimed at removing the use of instance-linked
instance_type objects, in favor of the decoupled type data in
system_metadata. See bug 1140119 for more details.

Change-Id: I885a807d00f7f909665da6e7a3382295a43258c9

commit_message:
Fix instance type cleanup when doing a same-id migration

Previously, we assumed that we were moving from one flavor to another during
a migration (i.e. a resize). That assumption failed when a regular migration
went to delete the old_ stashed instance types from system_metadata.

This unifies the cleanup logic, which only gets performed if we're actually
doing a resize.

Fixes bug 1136768

Change-Id: I0796864b044fc746583164e4a684f79dc431c137

commit_message:
Add conductor to nova-all.

The conductor service was missing so running nova-all no longer results
in a complete environment.

This patch adds conductor to the binary list and updates the code to
handle the different way in which conductor specifies the topic and
manager.

Fixes bug 1152371

Change-Id: I4862ad66216ab980e8636e9f3cdbabbace6ee73c

commit_message:
Build a new requirements list

This is the result of running a script (see next commit) which just
takes all of the pip-requires and test-requires files from our
projects and makes a consolidated list from them.

I had to do some manual cleanup to remove duplicates. This means it's
not a complete list since some of the requires are actually incompatible
like keystoneclient or sqlalchemy.

So, this still isn't sufficient to build a complete PyPI mirror from
yet, but it is closer to the current requirements set and doesn't
artificially pin us to specific versions.

We need to come back around and cap the version ranges according to
each upstream's policy for changing their release numbers when they
make incompatible changes:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-March/006331.html

Change-Id: I616aa67eee6c559906b2a7a2322686e0c6d846da

commit_message:
Delete tokens for user

Bug 1152283

There was a typo in the function that showed it
was untested.  This fixes the typo and adds a unit test

It also corrects the logic in the KVS backend to ignore
the user_id field when listing tokens by trust_id

Change-Id: I5325c04e53a09fce68f3d350e7502341a398aa05

commit_message:
Rework instance actions to work with cells

In a cells setup an instance action is recorded at the global cell level
while events try to get recorded in a child cell compute node or
scheduler.  The event recording fails because it can't find an action to
link to.  This patch adds the recording of actions at the child cell
level, and changes the API extension to query the db in a child cell for
the record of actions and events.

This does not address the fact that an action is recorded at the global
cell level.

Bug 1132935
Change-Id: I5831f146397e7afa2d93d26c5d6f9abb9bc6670d

commit_message:
Make nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows more explicit

* max_rows must be positive
    Provide a better error message of 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows
    --max_rows=' is negative.
* Requires a max_rows
* No hidden default of 5000

Fix bug 1145609
Fix bug 1151064

Change-Id: I9078ff2700a0329ac4aff68bb434be5f16a5a3f1

commit_message:
Minor fixes in db tests

It looks like a few db tests are using an illogical context for testing
visibility of images. Without these fixes, testing further down the line
in this chain of patches is busted.

Change-Id: I6d7460895db553572a0ce6da62984b7e52abee0c

commit_message:
Added versioning support to the swift client for containers using switch -e container to specify
container for revision history storage.

Example swift post container -e history_container

Fixed PEP8 line length issue
Modified help statement for switch option
Modified option variable for consistency

Change-Id: Iad538e524126273e700dfb74f16223dc6a02fd0d

commit_message:
Add minimal baremetal docs to compute admin guide.

This patch adds a minimal amount of information to the compute admin
guide for the new Baremetal driver. It primarily updates the driver and
config option lists, and includes a reference to the wiki page
for further information.

Partially addresses bug 1038344.

Change-Id: Ic1b6d424c2a6b726f5e89a0c7ddd36acf4bb94dc

Add volume support for openstack client

fix with dtroyer's comments
rebase
fix with dhellmann's comments
create/list/delete/show/set for volume commands

subject: Start both v1 and v2 api from one daemon.
messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-03-04 15:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Right now we have 2 functions that return whole apps that know how to route to paths like /v1/* and /v2/*. Would it be simpler to create 2 new functions that return apps that route to just the /* parts of v1 and v2, and then in the multi-app stuff we could associate /v1 and /v2 prefixes with those apps?'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-03-05 05:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-03-05 14:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

[{'created': '2013-03-07 18:09:03.000000000', 'message': 'Update tox.ini to support RHEL 6.x.

In order to support running unit tests on RHEL 6.x we need to patch
eventlet with contrib/redhat-eventlet.patch. We already
have support for this in the tools/install_venv_common.py but we
need to make a couple changes to allow tox to consume this:

1) Sync in the latest intall_venv_common.py from oslo. This changes
 patch to use the -N option (ignore already applied patches) and
 makes it safe to call the patching function more than once.

2) Add a new patch_tox_venv.py script in tools.

3) Update tox.ini to call patch_tox_venv.py before it runs tests and
 coverage.

NOTE: This will hopefully go away eventually once this patch lands:

 https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/89/add-a-timeout-argument-to-subprocesspopen#comment-3342969

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to support RHEL 6.x.

In order to support running unit tests on RHEL 6.x we need to patch
eventlet with contrib/redhat-eventlet.patch. We already
have support for this in the tools/install_venv_common.py but we
need to make a couple changes to allow tox to consume this:

1) Sync in the latest intall_venv_common.py from oslo. This changes
 patch to use the -N option (ignore already applied patches) and
 makes it safe to call the patching function more than once.

2) Add a new patch_tox_venv.py script in tools.

3) Update tox.ini to call patch_tox_venv.py before it runs tests and
 coverage.

NOTE: This will hopefully go away eventually once this patch lands:

 https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/89/add-a-timeout-argument-to-subprocesspopen#comment-3342969

Change-Id: I3e2b07c3f718e4aede5c5f231ff0cdb7721ec885

commit_message:
Handle missing units values in mongodb data.

Provide a units value if it's missing in the existing mongodb data. This
is for the backward compatibility issue when the data had been already
stored before the counter_unit field was added in our meter definition.

Fixed bug #1098603.

Change-Id: I1ff3e325dc9b226e4441de6f5f9118fced67cf33

Test coverage for NestedStack, and fix FnGetRefId

instead of evaluated during FnGetRefId
